[{'created': '2012-11-04 21:41:14.000000000', 'message': 'Switch from FLAGS to CONF in bin

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup
since FLAGS is already just another reference to CONF.

We leave the nova.flags imports until a later cleanup commit since
removing them may cause unpredictable problems due to config options not

Change-Id: Id0c59b2dc8002ec89ccbc5e5d7986fb68d3a693d
'}]
commit_message:
Switch from FLAGS to CONF in bin

Use the global CONF variable instead of FLAGS. This is purely a cleanup
since FLAGS is already just another reference to CONF.

We leave the nova.flags imports until a later cleanup commit since
removing them may cause unpredictable problems due to config options not
being registered.

Change-Id: Id0c59b2dc8002ec89ccbc5e5d7986fb68d3a693d

[{'created': '2012-11-03 00:17:49.000000000', 'message': 'better rfc support for OPTIONS and better CORS support

Change-Id: I40be059e8bbf3737dafc4e6fefa7598d05669c60
'}, {'created': '2012-11-03 00:24:41.000000000', 'message': 'better rfc support for OPTIONS and better CORS support

Change-Id: I40be059e8bbf3737dafc4e6fefa7598d05669c60
'}, {'created': '2012-11-04 18:38:54.000000000', 'message': "Better RFC support for OPTIONS and CORS preflight requests

Ensures that the Allow header is set for 405 responses from the proxy,
as per RFC 2616.

CORS preflight requests now require both the Origin and Access-
Control-Request-Method headers to get a successful (200) response. The
draft spec defines errors as a response with a non-200 status code.
This patch sets the CORS error response code to 401 (Not Authorized).
A later patch may choose to make this configurable.

Since OPTIONS is defined in RFC 2616 and is therefore not exclusive to
CORS, OPTIONS requests that don't include the proper CORS headers for
a preflight request should still return success with the proper RFC
2616 headers. This implies that CORS requests to non-CORS-supported
resources (like accounts) or requests to clusters that have not
enabled global CORS settings will still get a 200 response code (per
RFC 2616), but the response will not include CORS response headers.
This in turn implies that a CORS client must check both the response
status code and the response headers to parse the response from a
preflight request.

Further improvements to the OPTIONS verb not included in this patch
may include support of more top-level resources (eg / or /v1/) or
sending the configured constraints in the reponse body.

Change-Id: I40be059e8bbf3737dafc4e6fefa7598d05669c60
"}, {'created': '2012-11-05 20:45:45.000000000', 'message': 'Better RFC support for OPTIONS and CORS preflight requests

Ensures that the Allow header is set for 405 responses from the proxy,
as per RFC 2616.

CORS preflight requests now require both the Origin and Access-
Control-Request-Method headers to get a successful (200) response. The
draft spec defines errors as a response with a non-200 status code.
This patch sets the CORS error response code to 401 (Not Authorized).
A later patch may choose to make this configurable.

There is some ambiguity between RFC 2616 and the CORS draft spec
around what to do when a CORS request is made but the cluster has no
CORS information about the requested resource. This patch chooses to
return an error in this case because it is what would be simplest for
CORS client apps.

Further improvements to the OPTIONS verb not included in this patch
 include support of more top-level resources (eg / or /v1/) or
sending the configured constraints in the reponse body.

Change-Id: I40be059e8bbf3737dafc4e6fefa7598d05669c60
'}, {'created': '2012-11-06 04:15:32.000000000', 'message': 'Better RFC support for OPTIONS and CORS preflight requests

Ensures that the Allow header is set for 405 responses from the proxy,
as per RFC 2616.

CORS preflight requests now require both the Origin and Access-

This patch sets the CORS error response code to 401 (Not Authorized).
A later patch may choose to make this configurable.

There is some ambiguity between RFC 2616 and the CORS draft spec
around what to do when a CORS request is made but the cluster has no
CORS information about the requested resource. This patch chooses to
return an error in this case because it is what would be simplest for
CORS client apps.

Further improvements to the OPTIONS verb not included in this patch
 include support of more top-level resources (eg / or /v1/) or
sending the configured constraints in the reponse body.

Change-Id: I40be059e8bbf3737dafc4e6fefa7598d05669c60
'}]
commit_message:
Better RFC support for OPTIONS and CORS preflight requests

Ensures that the Allow header is set for 405 responses from the proxy,
as per RFC 2616.

CORS preflight requests now require both the Origin and Access-
Control-Request-Method headers to get a successful (200) response. The
draft spec defines errors as a response with a non-200 status code.
This patch sets the CORS error response code to 401 (Not Authorized).
A later patch may choose to make this configurable.

There is some ambiguity between RFC 2616 and the CORS draft spec
around what to do when a CORS request is made but the cluster has no
CORS information about the requested resource. This patch chooses to
return an error in this case because it is what would be simplest for
CORS client apps.

Further improvements to the OPTIONS verb not included in this patch
 include support of more top-level resources (eg / or /v1/) or
sending the configured constraints in the reponse body.

Change-Id: I40be059e8bbf3737dafc4e6fefa7598d05669c60

Is there a reference to this discussion? The general policy is that nothing should deviate openstack/common directory in any project from what's in upstream openstack/common. It lands there first, then update.py is used to sync it from there. http://wiki.openstack.org/CommonLibrary

This is a good fix, but it should go in through the right process."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-11-03 20:51:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

because this policy wasn't followed previously, the fix was since removed from nova - https://github.com/openstack/python-novaclient/blob/master/novaclient/openstack/common/setup.py

Everything under openstack/common is managed copy, not to be edited directly by commits."}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2012-11-05 09:03:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sean, 

ok thanks for clarifying. Do we have to resubmit now the same patch on Nova, Quantum, Glance etc or it will be automatically merged? In the second case, how much time will it take?'}, {'account_id': 1313, 'date': '2012-11-05 13:05:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Fixes setup compatibility issue on Windows

Fixes Bug #1052161

"python setup.py build" fails on Windows due to a hardcoded shell path:
/bin/sh

setup.py updated using openstack-common/update.py

Change-Id: Iafae444a43c76560020a84e3a1c5c8cb4b6860da

"}, {'created': '2012-11-06 02:40:13.000000000', 'message': "Don't verify image hashes if checksumming is disabled.

commit_message:
Don't verify image hashes if checksumming is disabled.

There was a bug where we were checking base image checksums, even
if checksumming was disabled, if there was already a cached checksum
for the image. This resolves bug 1075017.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I38f5914cd9d6326fdf5e5d7f0f57885ff8b5ff32

commit_message:
Increased MAC address range to reduce conflicts

Increased the 4th octet range from 7f to ff, making it consistent with
Quantum. This also reduces the probability of a MAC address conflict.

Fixes LP: #1050924

Change-Id: I801a852110c0a35e5a6a31f359df75475a21fd4a

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-11-02 15:12:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I like the direction of this patch, but I'd like to see even more from it.

There are 2 main ways of handling guest configuration in xenapi driver right now:
- filesystem injection
- communicating with nova-agent over xenstore

Now with the config-drive stuff, there will be 3 ways. It would be nice to make the configuration of which method more explicit than it currently is.

It's a little confusing how the different methods are configured (flat_injected vs xenapi_disable_agent).

Maybe we should be creating one configuration option (for all hypervisors?) to configure which guest configuration method (or methods)? should be used?"}, {'account_id': 5044, 'date': '2012-11-02 15:57:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Do you mean, that you should have to select one of:

flat_injected_network, config_drive, xenapi_agent

Is it possible, that one might want to run flat_injected_network together with xenapi_agent?'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-11-02 16:08:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

If using xenapi right now and flat_injected=True, then it will do both. That said, I don't know if that setup makes much sense.

I could see someone maybe wanting to configure both config_drive and xenapi_agent as a transition path perhaps.

It may be out of scope of this patch, but I wanted to bring it up since I had to dig into the code to better understand all of the knobs and I imagine it won't be any easier for users than a developer :)"}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-11-06 17:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-06 17:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

commit_message:
xenapi: Make agent optional

Related to blueprint xenapi-config-drive

As config drive and agent are doing similar operations, this change
makes it possible to disable agent, thus config drive could perform
these operations.

Change-Id: I3fa536cb0fb3b60ff5bc035be9d86afe35905240

[{'created': '2012-10-28 05:16:47.000000000', 'message': "improve sessions around floating_ip_get_by_address

improve session handling around calls to floating_ip_get_by_address.
Removed 'session' parameter from public method calls, and replaced
private calls with new method _floating_ip_get_by_address.

Some existing calls to floating_ip_get_by_address were easily rewritten
into a simple model_query().update() call and thus removed. Others can
be cleaned up later.

commit_message:
improve sessions around floating_ip_get_by_address

improve session handling around calls to floating_ip_get_by_address.
Removed 'session' parameter from public method calls, and replaced
private calls with new method _floating_ip_get_by_address.

Some existing calls to floating_ip_get_by_address were easily rewritten
into a simple model_query().update() call and thus removed. Others can
be cleaned up later.

blueprint db-cleanup

Change-Id: I4db11e6d7fda43420bca800c44c34efdefb8038a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-06 18:42:14.000000000', 'message': 'Sync latest notifier changes from openstack-common

Updates Quantum with the latest changes from openstack-commons
notifier package:

    Rename rabbit_notifier to rpc_notifier.

    The previous rabbit_notifier module is generic and can be used
    for all RPC notifications.

    This commit moves the rabbit_notifier module to rpc_notifier and
    adds a new deprecated rabbit_notifier module which can be used for
    Grizzly so that users can have a chance to easily upgrade this
    config setting.

Also updates the agent code and config file to reflect this change
(and get unit tests to pass)

Fixes LP Bug #1075330.

Change-Id: If9a4f5fa27638b25a29b66dbfed757554358ff7c
'}]
commit_message:
Sync latest notifier changes from openstack-common

Updates Quantum with the latest changes from openstack-commons
notifier package:

    Rename rabbit_notifier to rpc_notifier.

    The previous rabbit_notifier module is generic and can be used
    for all RPC notifications.

    This commit moves the rabbit_notifier module to rpc_notifier and
    adds a new deprecated rabbit_notifier module which can be used for
    Grizzly so that users can have a chance to easily upgrade this
    config setting.

Also updates the agent code and config file to reflect this change
(and get unit tests to pass)

Fixes LP Bug #1075330.

Change-Id: If9a4f5fa27638b25a29b66dbfed757554358ff7c

commit_message:
add doc to standardize session usage

Add doc to nova/db/sqlalchemy/session.py to outline some best practices
when using sessions within Nova, and also shows some things to avoid.
This will form the basis of much of the db-cleanup work.

Change-Id: Ib91a7fa3263e415fb6b8f88e79325c730550e576

commit_message:
Ability to specify a host restricted to admin.

Fixes bug 1070880

There is functionality in place, which uses the
format "az:host" on the --availability_zone
parameter to a create request to force scheduling
of an instance onto a specific host. However,
this is limited to users with Admin context.

This fix alters this behaviour to use a specific
policy action allowing fine-grained control over
which users have access to this functionality.

Change-Id: Ibb0e43492dfa2699ab26318736ca55a60b7b4468

commit_message:
Add ability of nova client to display availability zones when listing hosts

Implements the one workitem of blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

Add an optional parameter for nova host-list
Now, we can use the command: nova host-list --zone nova
It will return the hosts that availability_zone=nova.
This patch depends on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14741/

Change-Id: Ide41e75e7d1471e23d19f51e63a8d9951337a411

Updated the help text for nova list command.

Few options in the nova list command are admin specific. Updated the help text
to specify the admin only options explitcitly.

Fixes LP: #1055983

commit_message:
Add ability to disable secure volume delete.

Due to gating issues caused by secure delete on LVM volumes,
add the ability to disable via flag.secure_delete.

Default will be set to True, but we add a way for the gate tests
to disable this until we can come up with a fix for
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1023755 OR implement an alternative
secure delete method that doesn' suck.

Change-Id: I2a06e4f0021ba1f5d5aad7d0a5997a992e268858

During volume attach on Windows a process is spawned. The process
currently fails with the following exception, due to eventlet monkey
patching of the os module.

NotImplementedError: set_nonblocking() on a file object with no
setblocking() method (Windows pipes don't support non-blocking I/O)

nova-compute on Hyper-V

commit_message:
Fixes volume attach issue on Hyper-V

Fixes Bug: #1074717

During volume attach on Windows a process is spawned. The process
currently fails with the following exception, due to eventlet monkey
patching of the os module.

NotImplementedError: set_nonblocking() on a file object with no
setblocking() method (Windows pipes don't support non-blocking I/O)

The fix consists in avoiding monkey patching the os module in
nova-compute on Hyper-V

Change-Id: Ib513bc218da83b751439bad114baac24b08e3d02

run_tests.sh -p on Fedora 17.

commit_message:
Add option to disable Cinder secure delete.

Cinder secure delete has problems with the Precise kernel. Add option to
disabled it to allow the gate to run without failing when the kernel
gets cranky.

Change-Id: Ia241696342d77170a80329b6594d073111266230

commit_message:
Fixes setup compatibility issue on Windows

Fixes Bug #1052161

"python setup.py build" fails on Windows due to a hardcoded shell path:
/bin/sh

setup.py updated using openstack-common/update.py

Change-Id: I3943725a1f4b067a06f8f850e993c6867399a967

commit_message:
Add CINDER_SECURE_DELETE flag.

Defaults to true which means no change in behavoir.  Adds option
to disable secure delete as in https://review.openstack.org/15477.

Change-Id: I2b19ed4223460b550026ad4975080c0079c8b433

commit_message:
make QuantumV2 support requested nic ordering

fixes bug 1064524

The QuantumV2 did not honor nic ordering, so nics were attached in
Quantum's db natural order.  This patch sorts the networks honor requested nic
ordering when Nova calls the V2Quantum API.  Unit tests have been updated to
confirm ordering is honored.

Change-Id: I44a6a4736c78e86e83b6e682e63f93a5b47652da

commit_message:
Implemented HTTP POST notifier.

1. Implemented HTTP notifier - set the default behavior to send notification
for all events. To filter out specific events, user can specify a list of
events in configuration parameter callback_events_filter.
2. Added unit tests for the notifier.
3. Moved existing notifier tests to notifier directory.
4. Added the config params to the common conf.

Implements: blueprint http-notification-driver
Change-Id: I9bd3ab39ceba574db4ca12b29cc615922ccc2a27

[{'created': '2012-11-01 20:24:25.000000000', 'message': 'Install ceilometer policy.json file

Copy the policy.json file for ceilometer into place
and configure the API service to find it.

Change-Id: I39be13da0c86704d35e0ce3dc3d27fd38d787058
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}, {'created': '2012-11-01 21:06:26.000000000', 'message': 'Finish configuring ceilometer authentication

Copy the policy.json file for ceilometer into place
and configure the API service to find it.

Set the admin_user and admin_password in the ceilometer
config file for the middleware to use.

Change-Id: I39be13da0c86704d35e0ce3dc3d27fd38d787058
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}, {'created': '2012-11-05 11:55:33.000000000', 'message': 'Finish configuring ceilometer authentication

Copy the policy.json file for ceilometer into place
and configure the API service to find it.

Create a service user for ceilometer when the service
is enabled.

Use the service user for the admin_user and admin_password
in the ceilometer config file so the middleware can
verify tokens.

Change-Id: I39be13da0c86704d35e0ce3dc3d27fd38d787058
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Finish configuring ceilometer authentication

Copy the policy.json file for ceilometer into place
and configure the API service to find it.

Create a service user for ceilometer when the service
is enabled.

Use the service user for the admin_user and admin_password
in the ceilometer config file so the middleware can
verify tokens.

Change-Id: I39be13da0c86704d35e0ce3dc3d27fd38d787058
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Delete the child object via setting the parent's attribute to None.

Bug #1070335

We should not operate the foreigh key attribute of parent attribute
directly.

commit_message:
move python-cinderclient to pip-requires

python-cinderclient is now actually a requirement, move
this from test-requires to pip-requires to reflect that.

Fixes bug #1074085

Change-Id: Iea6c58faab2462d137049d690d58d951bd4e2c9e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-06 05:14:24.000000000', 'message': "Remove the zeroing out of the volume altogether

This is just a test to see if the token error in the gate
tests is in fact a new manifestation of the dd/kernel issue.

I suspect it's not, but will run recheck multiple times to see
if we get the same gate failure.  If we do then it's NOT the dd.

Change-Id: Ic8a08566e02d822ab0eb309f61993fd8b7d21232
"}, {'created': '2012-11-06 06:37:28.000000000', 'message': "Remove the zeroing out of the volume altogether

Temporary change to get in new version which will
make the secure_delete configurable.

After pushing this and modifying the gate setup we'll
push the flag version.

Change-Id: Ic8a08566e02d822ab0eb309f61993fd8b7d21232
"}]
commit_message:
Remove the zeroing out of the volume altogether

Temporary change to get in new version which will
make the secure_delete configurable.

After pushing this and modifying the gate setup we'll
push the flag version.

Change-Id: Ic8a08566e02d822ab0eb309f61993fd8b7d21232

LGTM, but what do you mean the EC2 test cases are meant to use the chance scheduler?'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-05 19:47:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Joe: I mean the original test code I patched here tried to use the chance scheduler, but in effect it was a no-op because multi scheduler was recently changed to not be the default scheduler_driver.  So, this restores the chance scheduler as the scheduler the tests use, as was originally intended.  I cannot comment on why that was the intended scheduler, however.. and I would love someone (else :) to make sure the tests work with the default (filter) scheduler.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-05 20:01:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

The default scheduler switched to the filter scheduler, and apparently
the EC2 tests are meant to use the chance scheduler for testing.  Also,
compute_scheduler_driver is not recognized when these tests are run

Fixes bug 1075293

Change-Id: I4a7cae4b3dbd18b8779c44e4c30718a872a82b0a
'}]
commit_message:
Use chance scheduler in EC2 tests

The default scheduler switched to the filter scheduler, and apparently
the EC2 tests are meant to use the chance scheduler for testing.  Also,
compute_scheduler_driver is not recognized when these tests are run
individually.

Fixes bug 1075293

Change-Id: I4a7cae4b3dbd18b8779c44e4c30718a872a82b0a

Why not move parse_ags into openstack.common.cfg?'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-05 20:00:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

parse_args() basically just passes project='nova' to CONF() - it's project specific code"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-05 20:03:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Right, but isn't the only project specific aspect of parse_args() the string 'nova'?  And won't other projects need the same function but with one word differences?"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-05 20:50:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

The text of the function is:

 def parse_args(argv, default_config_files=None):
    CONF.disable_interspersed_args()
    return argv[:1] + CONF(argv[1:],
                           project='nova',
                           default_config_files=default_config_files)

A version of this in cfg without any project specific code would be:

  def parse_args(argv, project, default_config_files=None):
      return CONF(argv[1:],
                  project=project,
                  default_config_files=default_config_files)

which isn't very useful and is only useful until a project wants to use one of the other args to CONF()"}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-05 21:26:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-11-06 07:17:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

[{'created': '2012-11-03 16:44:58.000000000', 'message': 'Shorten self.compute.resource_tracker in test_compute.py

Replace "self.compute.resource_tracker" with "self.rt" to make
long lines short. This is only a clean-up. This is not intended
a functional change, though it implies that
self.compute.resource_tracker is not re-assigned during each test.

This is a preparation for a later patch that implements multiple
resource_trackers in a compute manager. It will use
"self.compute._get_resource_tracker(None)" or something instead of
"self.compute.resource_tracker".

Change-Id: If2cfe9e2541b435893017b0f56960d715761548b

Change-Id: If2cfe9e2541b435893017b0f56960d715761548b

commit_message:
Shorten self.compute.resource_tracker in test_compute.py

Replace "self.compute.resource_tracker" with "self.rt" to make
long lines short. This is only a clean-up. This is not intended
a functional change, though it implies that
self.compute.resource_tracker is not re-assigned during each test.

This is a preparation for a later patch that implements multiple
resource_trackers in a compute manager. It will use
"self.compute._get_resource_tracker(None)" or something instead of
"self.compute.resource_tracker".

Change-Id: If2cfe9e2541b435893017b0f56960d715761548b

Testcase of listing collection shouldn't depend on default order of db query

When adding sort feature for quantum, found some testcase of listing
collection depend on default order of db query. Fix those testcase for
ports, networks, and subnets.

commit_message:
Removes regex validation of UUIDs in dhcp_agent

Removed re and quantum.api.v2 imports
Removed _validate_field method
Use uuidutils.is_uuid_like for uuid validation

Change-Id: I35e751969cf1f9ff7850fc01b8e4a3f6d788918e

commit_message:
Update KillFilter to handle 'deleted' exe's.

Updates KillFilter so that it handles the case where the executable
linked to by /proc/PID/exe is updated or deleted.

Includes new test case with coverage for this fix as well.

Fixes LP Bug #1073768

Change-Id: If568693e0b491f8806ff0156701766929ca0b3e0

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-05 17:53:21.000000000', 'message': 'Look up stuck-in-rebooting instances in manager

The poll_rebooting_instances() method for a virt driver can be
called periodically from the manager to handle instances that
may be stuck in a rebooting state. The only information passed
to the virt driver is the configured timeout, which means any
driver implementing this will have to do the same database
query: db.instance_get_all_hung_un_rebooting (..., timeout).

This patch makes the manager do this before calling the virt
driver, passing the appropriate set of instances, which avoids
the need for the driver to make that call.

Change-Id: I152cb8cd9a107f2d2b1df39401ab7bbe7ff366f1
'}, {'created': '2012-11-05 19:41:03.000000000', 'message': 'Look up stuck-in-rebooting instances in manager

The poll_rebooting_instances() method for a virt driver can be
called periodically from the manager to handle instances that
may be stuck in a rebooting state. The only information passed
to the virt driver is the configured timeout, which means any
driver implementing this will have to do the same database
query: db.instance_get_all_hung_un_rebooting (..., timeout).

This patch makes the manager do this before calling the virt
driver, passing the appropriate set of instances, which avoids
the need for the driver to make that call.

Related to bp/no-db-compute

Change-Id: I152cb8cd9a107f2d2b1df39401ab7bbe7ff366f1
'}]
commit_message:
Look up stuck-in-rebooting instances in manager

The poll_rebooting_instances() method for a virt driver can be
called periodically from the manager to handle instances that
may be stuck in a rebooting state. The only information passed
to the virt driver is the configured timeout, which means any
driver implementing this will have to do the same database
query: db.instance_get_all_hung_un_rebooting (..., timeout).

This patch makes the manager do this before calling the virt
driver, passing the appropriate set of instances, which avoids
the need for the driver to make that call.

Related to bp/no-db-compute

Change-Id: I152cb8cd9a107f2d2b1df39401ab7bbe7ff366f1

commit_message:
Fixes setup compatibility issue on Windows

Fixes Bug #1052161

"python setup.py build" fails on Windows due to a hardcoded shell path:
/bin/sh

setup.py updated using openstack-common/update.py

Change-Id: I9c8cf84ada189d8f27448ecda23f51c021d08818

commit_message:
Replace refs to 'Keystone API' with 'Identity API'

Formally, OpenStack Keystone implements the OpenStack Identity API, and
this is a client to the API, not to Keystone itself.

Change-Id: If568866221a29ba041f0f2cd56dc81deeb9ebc00

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-01 12:08:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

We really need to finish killing exception from openstack-common.  We've been working to avoid importing it.  We've just been localizing exceptions to the module that uses them instead.

We've also been avoiding using the generic 'utils' module in favor of creating some more specific utils modules.  I'm not sure where to put execute ... but that's the idea.

It also appears that there have been some changes to nova's execute() method that haven't been merged into common, so that should be done first."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-11-01 12:35:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

They're all fair comments. The location of execute() in utils was done a while ago by someone else. I'm happy enough to move it though."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-01 12:43:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Yeah, Russell is right - utils.execute() is fairly stale and a common execute() method should live in executils() or similar"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-11-06 02:56:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

This needs to wait for a new execute() in common, which is delayed by needing rootwrap in common.'}]

commit_message:
Import common's utils.execute and deps, start conversion.

Convert libvirt callers across to the common version, I will progressively
move the others over in separate reviews to keep the length of this review
down to something reasonable.

commit_message:
Send all aggregate data to add_aggregate_host.

Update the add_aggregate_host method of the compute rpc api to take in
all aggregate data instead of just the aggregate id.  This avoids a db
lookup in the nova-compute service.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: Iaccfa28ac23452a4e78581c6b5a6687417283838

commit_message:
Update devstack exercises to call cinderclient

Exercises use nova volume-* commands still.  This works fine,
however moving forward now that cinder is the default volume service
we should use the cinderclient explicitly for the applicable calls.

Attach/Detach are still novaclient commands, however the others
(create, delete, list, etc) should be cinderclient.

Change-Id: I336de1b69a32eee6c91655b0a5bf8541b243f2f0

commit_message:
Fix migrations when not using multi-host network

Commit d96102b6251d caused rpc.calls to network manager to occur for
non-multi-host configs, but they get sent to the
network.<destination_compute> topic when they should just go to
'network'.

Fixes bug 1075245

Change-Id: If2bb8b3897efb59b8dc41ea136b08146e4e56270

commit_message:
Remove api-guide 'examples' section

fixes bug 1072353

This section only existed to link to a website which claimed to have
the examples present in the book. Unfortunately, this website does
not exist, so the best course of action is to remove the section.

Change-Id: Ibb669c05e00ba641823cbc91156fef0716e52777

commit_message:
make scripted keystone install more visible

fixes bug 1073387

This patch adds a note block around the mention of an automated
method for performing the many manual steps of keystone
installation. This text was previously there, but users didn't
notice it.

Patchset adds links to scripted section in two places.

Change-Id: I36153ef64f28067efce51e6eaa3fafb5b403b1ff

commit_message:
Send all migration data to finish_revert_resize.

Update the finish_revert_resize method of the compute rpc api to take
all of the migration data instead of just the migration id.
This removes the need for doing a db read at the beginning of
finish_revert_resize.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I725404a13408fdd83aef6d19bab6c9481e2eab35

commit_message:
Send all migration data to revert_resize.

Update the revert_resize method of the compute rpc api to take all of
the migration data instead of just the migration id.  This removes the
need for doing a db read at the beginning of revert_resize.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I821cfcbd8edf83a0ffdf64100b6f9224205dea0a

commit_message:
Fix keystoneclient so swift works against Rackspace Cloud Files

Fixes bug 1074784
https://bugs.launchpad.net/python-keystoneclient/+bug/1074784

RAX auth doesn't return a service catalog with an identity endpoint
that contains an auth URL.  This causes swift client to log an
error of "Authorization Failure. Authorization Failed: Endpoint not
found."

Change-Id: I26174a664029617f097dc35c57ef30b34cd2fb61

commit_message:
xenapi: place boot lock when doing soft delete

If an instance is soft deleted a boot lock should be placed to ensure
it doesn't get restarted by accident.

Change-Id: Id46b8758f71d122d2a9cf7ae172fc138974bc315

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-02 22:18:52.000000000', 'message': 'Enforce use of latest django_openstack_auth for PKI compat.

The latest django_openstack_auth supports PKI-signed tokens by
using Keystone's "is_ans1_token" function to determine if PKI
tokens are in use and react approriately if so.

Fixes bug 1071865

Change-Id: I62ba6370de829345d3214d80011a58e4ac6cd218
'}]
commit_message:
Enforce use of latest django_openstack_auth for PKI compat.

The latest django_openstack_auth supports PKI-signed tokens by
using Keystone's "is_ans1_token" function to determine if PKI
tokens are in use and react approriately if so.

Fixes bug 1071865

Change-Id: I62ba6370de829345d3214d80011a58e4ac6cd218

commit_message:
Use spawn_n when not capturing return value

If not capturing the return value, spawn_n is more efficient.

Change-Id: Ie6baa934e81e17e2d73f70766628d4bc97b7aa5e

commit_message:
Tweak rpc.queue_get_for to deal with host=None.

Make rpc.queue_get_for() just a tad more convenient by dealing with the
case of host=None.  In that case, just return the base topic.

Change-Id: I2f55c2205c219df7481dd6e507caf7182622195b

commit_message:
Rename rabbit_notifier to rpc_notifier.

The previous rabbit_notifier module is generic and can be used
for all RPC notifications.

This commit moves the rabbit_notifier module to rpc_notifier and
adds a new deprecated rabbit_notifier module which can be used for Grizzly
so that users can have a chance to easily upgrade this config setting.

Once this lands here I'd like to do the same in Quantum.

Change-Id: I95073b1a8e06673d8e7363a4b37c050adbad97c5

commit_message:
Restore proper LoggerTestCase

Addresses bug #1075022
Addresses bug #1075028

LoggerTestCase was no longer running
as another test was created with this name
(presumably due to copy-paste)

The duplicate has been renamed to a
more appropriate name: LogLevelTestCase.

Because LoggerTestCase was not executing,
bitrot has occurred. This patch also addresses
those resultant test failures.

Change-Id: I4f3820ba748d20606bb484d0adbfe678fa1fa38d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-02 22:43:04.000000000', 'message': "Split swob.content_range_header() into two methods.

content_range_header() took an optional parameter 'value_only'. If
true, it returned just the header value; if false, the whole header.
At all the call sites, value_only was either a hardcoded True or
False.

Instead, let's have two methods (one for the full header, one for the
header value) and just call the right one.

Change-Id: I3aa03aca233437e9bdbed7edf9622756e19b4c49
"}]
commit_message:
Split swob.content_range_header() into two methods.

content_range_header() took an optional parameter 'value_only'. If
true, it returned just the header value; if false, the whole header.
At all the call sites, value_only was either a hardcoded True or
False.

Instead, let's have two methods (one for the full header, one for the
header value) and just call the right one.

Change-Id: I3aa03aca233437e9bdbed7edf9622756e19b4c49

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-05 18:32:10.000000000', 'message': 'Handle list properties that do not contain objects

The previous implementation of schema verfication on properties required
that the schema for the contents of a property list always be a map. Now
this is specified explicitly, so that in theory a property could also be a
list of Strings or Integers.

Change-Id: Icdd9a6c9f9b1e884f959c74f0803b7f3bd2aecc4
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Handle list properties that do not contain objects

The previous implementation of schema verfication on properties required
that the schema for the contents of a property list always be a map. Now
this is specified explicitly, so that in theory a property could also be a
list of Strings or Integers.

Change-Id: Icdd9a6c9f9b1e884f959c74f0803b7f3bd2aecc4
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

Its functionality has been completely superceded by the new Properties
and Parameters implementations.

Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Get rid of Resource.calculate_properties()

Use the new Properties class to lazily load property values so that we
always get the latest data, and get rid of the stateful hacks.

Change-Id: I02a1b927606da217d4adab1ca04b659abadda2ce
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add a Properties implementation with lazy loading

This will allow property values to be calculated on demand, rather than
stored as state.

Change-Id: I93fefa911b96c931cbf48b82b5a7ccc13ad99168
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-11-05 16:42:40.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid modifying the Properties of a Load Balancer

Properties are defined by the template, and should not be modified. In this
case it was just as a convenience, since the value does not actually need
to be persisted beyond even the current call.

Change-Id: I6ca07989d246ec618b2ca5f051f8e614e24c81ae
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid modifying the Properties of a Load Balancer

Properties are defined by the template, and should not be modified. In this
case it was just as a convenience, since the value does not actually need
to be persisted beyond even the current call.

Change-Id: I6ca07989d246ec618b2ca5f051f8e614e24c81ae
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Log loaded extension messages as INFO not WARNING.

Updates the log statement we use when an extension is loaded
to log as info instead of warn.

Fixes LP Bug #1074889.

Change-Id: Ibf5a8a38a1f37c55ca99e0e2209a48ba04d609ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-05 16:40:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix schemata errors for properties

In particular, Integer refers to a literal integer in the JSON markup:

  {"IntegerProperty": 42}

So use Number to refer to a string-encoded number:

  {"NumberProperty": "42"}

Change-Id: Id285ae6145ba888f59529207343d016fba3825eb
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix schemata errors for properties

In particular, Integer refers to a literal integer in the JSON markup:

  {"IntegerProperty": 42}

So use Number to refer to a string-encoded number:

  {"NumberProperty": "42"}

Change-Id: Id285ae6145ba888f59529207343d016fba3825eb
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-02 23:46:55.000000000', 'message': 'Remove old docs on iscsitarget

fixes bugs 1073497

iscsitarget was replaced with tgt some time ago, and the docs
were still installing it despite tgt being pulled in as a
dependency, breaking things badly. This patch removes the install
step for the old pkg, and replaces it with appropriate values.

Change-Id: I01fa2ab77f5d50fd912644741509ca2dba112a21
'}]
commit_message:
Remove old docs on iscsitarget

fixes bugs 1073497

iscsitarget was replaced with tgt some time ago, and the docs
were still installing it despite tgt being pulled in as a
dependency, breaking things badly. This patch removes the install
step for the old pkg, and replaces it with appropriate values.

Change-Id: I01fa2ab77f5d50fd912644741509ca2dba112a21

subject: Fixes volume attach issue on Hyper-V
messages:
[{'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-05 13:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

Please just submit an updated patch on the original change ID.  If you abandon and open a new one we lose review history.  If you see false test failures and you want to retrigger it, just leave a review that says only "recheck" (for the first set of tests) or "reverify" (for the gating tests).'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-05 13:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

link to the original review: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15337/'}, {'account_id': 3185, 'date': '2012-11-05 14:05:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-05 13:42:05.000000000', 'message': "Fixes volume attach issue on Hyper-V

Fixes Bug: #1074717

During volume attach on Windows a process is spawned. The process
currently fails with the following exception, due to eventlet monkey
patching of the os module.

NotImplementedError: set_nonblocking() on a file object with no
setblocking() method (Windows pipes don't support non-blocking I/O)

The fix consists in avoiding monkey patching the os module in
nova-compute on Hyper-V

Change-Id: I839312fd10ab20a5d289934ca0107bfc8225a8b1
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes volume attach issue on Hyper-V

Fixes Bug: #1074717

During volume attach on Windows a process is spawned. The process
currently fails with the following exception, due to eventlet monkey
patching of the os module.

NotImplementedError: set_nonblocking() on a file object with no
setblocking() method (Windows pipes don't support non-blocking I/O)

The fix consists in avoiding monkey patching the os module in
nova-compute on Hyper-V

Change-Id: I839312fd10ab20a5d289934ca0107bfc8225a8b1

Fixes setup compatibility issue on Windows

Fixes Bug #1052161

"python setup.py build" fails on Windows due to a hardcoded shell path:
/bib/sh.

Change-Id: I6c187c78b1cfec729e79398667a04a023212d353

Add uuidutils module

Added uuidutils to openstack-common.conf file and

commit_message:
Fixes setup compatibility issue on Windows

Fixes Bug #1052161

"python setup.py build" fails on Windows due to a hardcoded shell path:
/bin/sh

Change-Id: Ic5c1919a13011ae8fb00e2c14b214026f4191c38

- http://logs.openstack.org/14556/2/check/gate-openstack-common-python27/717 : SUCCESS
"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-05 07:18:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Looks like this still isn't working

It looks like the sleep is there to ensure that the function in the parent runs first

If the child runs first, it's failing? If it's failing, it's probably because the second write succeeds? Is the child not closing its read pipe properly for some reason?

You could do something more straightforward like:

  @synchronized
  def f(tempdir, myfile, otherfile):
      myfile = os.path.join(tempdir, myfile)
      otherfile = os.path.join(tempdir, otherfile)
      self.assertFalse(os.path.exists(otherfile))
      with file(myfile, 'w'):
          pass
      time.sleep(0.5)
      self.assertFalse(otherfile)
      os.remove(myfile)
      

  pid = os.fork()
  if pid > 0:
      f(tempdir, 'parent', 'child')
  else:
      f(tempdir, 'child', 'parent')"}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-11-05 07:18:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-11-05 07:18:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yeah, the sleep was the simple way to get the existing test ported across. I'd hoped that removing a try / finally had fixed the problem (some sort of race in cleanup), but it seems ordering is important here. Once I'm got my head together post the flight home I will have another look at this."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-05 07:18:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Make external lock test clearer.

This doesn't really resolve bug 1068316, mainly because I now believe
the sleep is needed in order to gaurantee resource contention. Comments
welcome.

Change-Id: I6d729523895ec2bd1d8110140a1822bd2d78f403

commit_message:
Remove openstack.common.config and extensions.

Remove the config module.  All core openstack projects are using the cfg
module instead so no further development will be done on this module.

Also remove the extensions module.  This code was imported but there has
been no attempt to get any projects to use it.

Change-Id: I4a974ba1ea25e94fd55cad243cde5f1ef6a17289

commit_message:
Log CONF from ProcessLauncher.wait, like ServiceLauncher

Fixes bug #1050380

In the unit tests, we need to call CONF so that the config-file option
referenced by log_opt_values() is registered. We also need unregister
the default_publisher_id option to workaround bug #107372.

Change-Id: Icc63237ddf97aaa730c0484974ec05a3080f8f04

commit_message:
Relax the update.py replace regex.

In service.py there is an import like:
try:
    from openstack.common import rpc
except:
    rpc = None

and this currently does not get converted.
The only downside is some doc strings also get
converted.

Change-Id: If283b50b8e889c0a1878e30cd7ff58494fabe634

Also, I found that the places which use gen_uuid or str_uuid are using uuid as a local variable that cleaning up these methods will be quite a burden.

However I still think using uuidutils.uuid4_str() and uuidutils.uuid4_hex() has less code entropy then str(uuid.uuid4()) and uuid.uuid4().hex respectively.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-11-05 06:45:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Fixes setup compatibility issue on Windows

Fixes Bug #1052161

"python setup.py build" fails on Windows due to a hardcoded shell path:
/bib/sh.

Change-Id: Iee0a1fcbdabfd469e92fa73002763d419e75ec27

[{'created': '2012-11-05 04:46:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add a set of native quantum resource types.

The properties schemas map directly to the Quantum REST API, which makes
the implementation (and documentation) simpler.

The base class QuantumResource contains some default methods and
common utility functions.

templates/Quantum.template can be run without any parameters and only creates
network resources, no instances.

More example templates and tests will come later.

Change-Id: Ia270294440eeec5163e35009f6be0b5db9ad78c1
'}]
commit_message:
Add a set of native quantum resource types.

The properties schemas map directly to the Quantum REST API, which makes
the implementation (and documentation) simpler.

The base class QuantumResource contains some default methods and
common utility functions.

templates/Quantum.template can be run without any parameters and only creates
network resources, no instances.

More example templates and tests will come later.

Change-Id: Ia270294440eeec5163e35009f6be0b5db9ad78c1

commit_message:
Recursively replace all : with . in Output keys.

This is needed so that some Quantum properties with colons in the keys are not
interpreted as xml namespaces.

Change-Id: Iba5290a408595b2f028744c10315daac29da055e

commit_message:
Rename heat client to heat-cfn.

This is to allow python-heatclient to eventually become the default heat
client.

Documentation in heat.wiki will be updated to refer to heat-cfn when this
change is pushed.

Change-Id: I2209c36adf41fa5d0df0caf9200f7fedbdd51805

'}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-10-23 19:09:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Is this just to split out the use of nova's wrap_db_error?"}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2012-10-24 03:09:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Eric Windisch: I and our team have another patch, which is in review, connecting to a DB other than nova-DB (=bare-metal-DB). Connecting to another DB can be achieved by almost same code. But it needs another _ENGINE and _MAKER dedicating to the DB. So currently we use a copy of nova-DB's session.py to connect to bare-metal-DB and it brings much duplication in two session.py.

In this patch, I take the common part out as session_utils.py to reduce the duplication.

(We tried another approach that stores _ENGINE and _MAKER in dictionary keyed by sql_connection, but gave it up since it has some difficulty.)

session.py for bare-metal-DB:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/10726/21/nova/virt/baremetal/db/sqlalchemy/session.py"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-10-24 20:37:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

If session_utils.py can be used from code that connects to another DB, why isn't it one level up in the directory hierarchy?  Or are you talking about having parts of nova connecting to two different sqlalchemy-supported databases, one being the nova database, the other being for something else (e.g., bare metal)?"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-10-24 20:39:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

For reference, I'm looking at this from the perspective of trying to move these bits shortly into oslo-incubator (i.e. openstack-common)."}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2012-10-25 05:19:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@Kevin L. Mitchell: bare-metal-nova-compute connects to both nova-DB and bare-metal-DB (both using sqlalchemy). We put code related to bare-metal DB in nova/virt/baremetal/db because 
 * bare-metal-DB is independent from nova-DB; it has its own api, schema, etc.
 * it is used from only bare-metal-nova-compute and commands for management, and the other components don't need to touch bare-metal DB at all.

(Am I misunderstanding your question?)"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-10-29 18:00:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'd like to discuss this more in relation to moving code into common-db. I don't particularly like the new naming/interface here and have a few ideas we should probably discuss offline (i.e. outside of gerrit)"}, {'account_id': 159, 'date': '2012-10-29 19:10:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

We'll probably want to change session_utils.py back into session.py when we move this to common, but I'm thinking this will help with the migration to common (eliminating the globals)"}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2012-10-30 05:06:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3068, 'date': '2012-10-30 05:19:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

An client code (bare-metal) imports and uses it like this:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/22930/'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-30 05:30:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

commit_message:
Make session.py reusable

This patch get_engine() into a creation part (create_session())
and a singletonization part (get_session()). create_session() can
be used from code that connects to a DB other than nova-DB.

Change-Id: Ia4ee4336871f22cfcdb67a0417fcfb76d78b6fa3

commit_message:
Update openstack-common, add network_utils.

This is required by impl_kombu.py. The engine failed to start without it.

commit_message:
pin sqlalchemy to 0.7.x but not specifically 0.7.8

last night's release of sqlalchemy 0.8.0b1 broke
our build we need to stick to 0.7.x however a quick
patch put us strictly on 0.7.8.  The nova guys put
out a more elegant patch so I'd like to incorporate.

Change-Id: Ibf2a09826ed175f844be8551d68b5420aa132f6f

commit_message:

fixes bug 1073015

commit_message:
Add PostgreSQL support to devstack

This patch adds an interface for supporting multiple database backend
types and implemnts support for PostgreSQL. It also adds a function,
use_exclusive_service, which serves as a base for enabling a service
that conflicts with other services. The use_database function uses it,
and it might also be useful for selecting messaging backends.

MySQL is still selected by default. Tested on Fedora 17 and Ubuntu
12.04 with MySQL and PostgreSQL. Implements blueprint postgresql-support

Change-Id: I4b1373e25676fd9a9809fe70cb4a6450a2479174

Change-Id: If88088fc287a2f2f4f3e34f6d9be9de3da7ee00d
'}, {'created': '2012-10-31 18:27:41.000000000', 'message': "Configure PKI cache dirs

* Configure Cinder, Glance, Keystone, Nova to put cached credentials
  from keystone.auth_token into /var/cache/<service>

It is not obvious to me that having each of these service share a
credentials cache is a good idea.  It does appear to work but this
patch takes the conservative approach of putting each service's cache
in a distinct directory.

More importantly it gets them out of $HOME!

Change-Id: If88088fc287a2f2f4f3e34f6d9be9de3da7ee00d
"}]
commit_message:
Configure PKI cache dirs

* Configure Cinder, Glance, Keystone, Nova to put cached credentials
  from keystone.auth_token into /var/cache/<service>

It is not obvious to me that having each of these service share a
credentials cache is a good idea.  It does appear to work but this
patch takes the conservative approach of putting each service's cache
in a distinct directory.

More importantly it gets them out of $HOME!

Change-Id: If88088fc287a2f2f4f3e34f6d9be9de3da7ee00d

commit_message:
handles empty dhcp_domain with hostname in metadata

Fixes bug 1064713.

Currently hostname in metadata is created by concatenating the
instance hostname with the dhcp_domain. When dhcp_domain is empty,
it results in a hostname with a trailing dot.

Change-Id: I52a50ff7f62c0a0dc900ddf707cc3dddce62bcb3
(cherry picked from commit 46b7b6392575c645a0d34739605d9165f4358d8a)

 * Tempest configuration relies on having other services such as

commit_message:
Ensure that tempest configuration happens last.

 * Tempest configuration relies on having other services such as
   Glance and Nova running and accepting requests.  Previously,
   configuration was happening before these services were started.
   This change ensures that Tempest configuration is performed
   after the necessary services have been started.

Change-Id: If0b6753dd51671fbc2a2cf6ad32ce9303d0a0479

commit_message:
Eliminates simultaneous schedule race.

Keeps host state in memory so multiple schedule attempts use the
up-to-date values that may have been modified by another greenthread.

Fixes bug 1073956

Change-Id: I69fdd9b46bde6b7408c501c42a6ef3b6dd92bbc2

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-22 19:05:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Just want to get some more feedback before going this direction. Changing the dhcp driver seems much more useful than changing all of linux_net, but having two different places to config drivers seems excessive.  Since this adds support for configuration that might actually be useful, perhaps we should remove the network_driver configuration option and just always make it use linux_net."}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-10-23 13:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

If your concern is about network_driver import in LinuxNetDHCPDriver, we can easily get rid of it since it had been done just to keep all possible logic in place.

network_driver is also used elsewhere for VPN, for example, so to remove this option we should add some other options.'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-10-24 17:53:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(4 inline comments)

I think the general idea of allowing other implementations of this bit makes sense.  I left some basic code comments ...

However, most importantly, I'm not sure that as a community we should be encouraging new development work on the nova-network code.  I would *really* like to see any and all efforts focused on improving quantum and quantum's integration with nova.  Patches like this are a distraction from that and do not help us toward the long term goal.  I think we may even should go as far as locking down nova-network to nothing but bug fixes and anything needed to better integrate with quantum.  Thoughts on this?"}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-10-25 09:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (2 inline comments)

An example of separate driver (the reason for this change) is here: https://github.com/gapinc/openstack-nova-infoblox
It works with Infoblox appliance, configures its DHCP and DNS services (see README there).'}, {'account_id': 708, 'date': '2012-10-25 11:23:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-25 11:43:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Abstract out all DHCP calls.

This allows user to switch to a DHCP server other than dnsmasq to use with
instances.

Change-Id: Ie3d21152205379ecf379eb0bb0b2611fac7125c8

Glance client displays version

Glance client displays the current version of glanceclient being
used using the --version option

Fixes bug 1056504

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-26 00:35:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

unfortunately ips are not always in the db. Might have more luck listing ips that are in the network info cache along with the instance."}, {'account_id': 2271, 'date': '2012-10-27 00:51:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This was done as part of the blueprint moving nova-manage commands into API calls. If you look at bin/nova-manage:FixedIpCommands.list(), you'll see that it does basically the same thing (but with a series of horrible caches). So it seems that if this is broken, nova-manage is similarly broken.

So, the question is -- do we want to change how this works as part of making nova-manage into API calls, or do we want to limit the scope of the work performed for this blueprint?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-03 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-03 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

This is an attempt to push much of the fixed ip listing logic down
into the database layer to reduce the need to build caches before
displaying information to the user.

Progresses blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

Change-Id: Idae2ac91f6d735bc48f31a07ad6b89cf6314b49c
'}]
commit_message:
Detailed fixed ip lookup.

This is an attempt to push much of the fixed ip listing logic down
into the database layer to reduce the need to build caches before
displaying information to the user.

Progresses blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

Change-Id: Idae2ac91f6d735bc48f31a07ad6b89cf6314b49c

commit_message:
Use pypi for python-swiftclient dependency.

Using github as a package source is less reliable in the Jenkins test
framework than using pypi. This is because the Jenkins test framework
has a local pypi mirror.

Change-Id: Ia904d39ce70f5c2bd7d6edb9172f8226131074e2

which works well with greenthreads. Adding new
parameters ssh_min_pool_conn and ssh_max_pool_conn.

commit_message:
Adding a SSH Connection Pool.

Adds a connection pool using eventlet.pools
which works well with greenthreads. Adding new
parameters ssh_min_pool_conn and ssh_max_pool_conn.

Updating the _run_ssh method in san.py to use the
connection pool and cleaning up the existing
single connections, also added retries.

Fixes bug 1074185

Change-Id: I90dd89ffc025d09fc6ad060c4273508103b85456

commit_message:
Fixes utils.findresource checking for integer

Fixes the novaclient.utils.find_resource function to properly handle
non integer values and not break with an AttributeError.

Adds a test case to test a few more non valid inputs.

Fixes bug #1065367

Change-Id: Iaa2025f4eb580234f754596c3572e2f87872170e

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 67, 'name': 'Vish Ishaya', 'email': 'vishvananda@gmail.com', 'username': 'vishvananda'}, {'_account_id': 100, 'name': 'Johannes Erdfelt', 'email': 'johannes@erdfelt.com', 'username': 'johannes.erdfelt'}, {'_account_id': 679, 'name': 'Kevin L. Mitchell', 'email': 'klmitch@mit.edu', 'username': 'klmitch'}, {'_account_id': 1030, 'name': 'Chris Behrens', 'email': 'cbehrens@codestud.com', 'username': 'cbehrens'}, {'_account_id': 1561, 'name': 'Russell Bryant', 'email': 'rbryant@redhat.com', 'username': 'russellb'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-01 20:03:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/15220/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/2265 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-11-01 20:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

init_host and pre_start_hook look like they effectively run at the same time. Is there any reason to keep them separate?'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-01 21:24:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'm not sure, TBH.  I was considering it when I added these.  The distinction I made between the 2 was whether the service record had been created yet or not.  It seemed valuable to allow init_host() to raise an Exception and bypass creating the service entry.  The pre_start_hook() could then run after the service entry was created, assuming it may want to access it.  (Note I also wanted to rename init_host() to init_hook() or something, but I left it out of here.)"}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-02 14:21:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Do you have a case where they need to be separate?  I think I'd have a hard time deciding which hook I'm supposed to use for most things (between init_host and pre_start_hook)."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-02 15:50:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

RussellB:  The compute manager call to update_available_resources requires the service record exist... so the current init_host() will not work where it is positioned in service.py.  I could move the init_host() call to be after the service record is created... but the current init_host() in compute manager could definitely raise an exception that would halt start-up.  It seems like a good idea to not create a service record in this case, since it failed to start... but I certainly don't have a strong opinion on it. ;)  I could move init_host() down to replace the pre_start_hook() I've added."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-02 18:55:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Alright, I'm good with this then"}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-11-02 20:49:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-11-02 20:51:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-02 20:52:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-02 20:55:38.000000000', 'message': "Remove unnecessary db call from xenapi/vmops

There are two db.instance_type_get() calls in xenapi
that don't need to be there. By fetching the info out of
the instance['instance_type'] field, we can avoid the lookup
(and adding interfaces to support this in VirtAPI).

Note that the tests require a little extra fakeage to
replicate what is happening in the real db driver.

Change-Id: I727c98fe18ca28f1db62ece2abfd50b4e13852ba
"}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary db call from xenapi/vmops

There are two db.instance_type_get() calls in xenapi
that don't need to be there. By fetching the info out of
the instance['instance_type'] field, we can avoid the lookup
(and adding interfaces to support this in VirtAPI).

Note that the tests require a little extra fakeage to
replicate what is happening in the real db driver.

Change-Id: I727c98fe18ca28f1db62ece2abfd50b4e13852ba

commit_message:
Minor optimization in create_volume in HpSanISCSIDriver

Removing extra call to getClusterInfo in HpSANISCSIDriver
on every create_volume call. The cluster info is now
being lazily stored in a local variable.

Fixes bug 1074201

Change-Id: Iadf8383dbf87a8e82c649c312c67978c7dd3df71

commit_message:
sync deprecated log method from openstack-common

the nova common deprecated util is now part of openstack-common
log class as a deprecate method. Sync openstack-common and remove
nova common util. All the deprecated pieces from folsom appear
to have already been removed, so no additional code changes needed
for this.

Change-Id: I9cbd6a67c30567cd7002e8e7fec93cfc209787fc

Commit d96102b6 made a change to network.api.API but rather than making
the corresponding change to network.quantumv2.api.API it appears that
it was changed to match the network manager signature instead.

Fix the quantum signatures to match the stock network API signatures.

Change-Id: I97e16f29473f3f2e3f9c53b1e2ef10e499cef29a
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Quantum v2 API method signatures

Commit d96102b6 made a change to network.api.API but rather than making
the corresponding change to network.quantumv2.api.API it appears that
it was changed to match the network manager signature instead.

Fix the quantum signatures to match the stock network API signatures.

Change-Id: I97e16f29473f3f2e3f9c53b1e2ef10e499cef29a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-02 17:51:00.000000000', 'message': 'Use elevated context in disassociate_floating_ip

The call to service_get_by_host_and_topic would raise AdminRequired
in the case that a non-admin tried to disassociate a floating ip
from their instance and multi_host was on. Using an elevated
context for the db lookup enables the host lookup to happend and
allows a user to disassociate their floating ips.

Fixes bug 1074437

Change-Id: I3d47b5a48eae21ea913120bd00728a0b8132da81
'}]
commit_message:
Use elevated context in disassociate_floating_ip

The call to service_get_by_host_and_topic would raise AdminRequired
in the case that a non-admin tried to disassociate a floating ip
from their instance and multi_host was on. Using an elevated
context for the db lookup enables the host lookup to happend and
allows a user to disassociate their floating ips.

Fixes bug 1074437

Change-Id: I3d47b5a48eae21ea913120bd00728a0b8132da81

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-02 20:33:01.000000000', 'message': 'Remove dead code in swob.Response.__init__.

self.status would have been "200 OK", not 200, so the branch was never
taken. self.status_int would have been 200.

This looked like part of an attempt to honor the Range header in GET
requests. However, when I changed the code to check if self.status_int
== 200, the behavior gets weird. In the case of a GET request w/Range
header, the status gets changed from a 200 (from the underlying
app/middleware stack) into a 206. However, the response body isn't
actually changed to be of the right length. The net result is a
response w/status "206 Partial Content" that actually contains the
full content.

RFC 2616 section 14.35.2 says "A server MAY ignore the Range header."
The right thing to do is either (a) return a 206 with actual partial
content, or (b) ignore the Range header. For object GETs, there's
already code to do (a) [see commit ce274b3]. For other GETs, we should
ignore the Range header instead of returning a Frankenresponse.

This code is dead, and rightly so; let's bury it six feet deep in the
bit bucket.

Fixes bug 1068279.

Change-Id: Id648dfda9cba45012b5da097a235598fbd97c8b0
'}]
commit_message:
Remove dead code in swob.Response.__init__.

self.status would have been "200 OK", not 200, so the branch was never
taken. self.status_int would have been 200.

This looked like part of an attempt to honor the Range header in GET
requests. However, when I changed the code to check if self.status_int
== 200, the behavior gets weird. In the case of a GET request w/Range
header, the status gets changed from a 200 (from the underlying
app/middleware stack) into a 206. However, the response body isn't
actually changed to be of the right length. The net result is a
response w/status "206 Partial Content" that actually contains the
full content.

RFC 2616 section 14.35.2 says "A server MAY ignore the Range header."
The right thing to do is either (a) return a 206 with actual partial
content, or (b) ignore the Range header. For object GETs, there's
already code to do (a) [see commit ce274b3]. For other GETs, we should
ignore the Range header instead of returning a Frankenresponse.

This code is dead, and rightly so; let's bury it six feet deep in the
bit bucket.

Fixes bug 1068279.

Change-Id: Id648dfda9cba45012b5da097a235598fbd97c8b0

[{'created': '2012-11-02 18:44:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix signing_dir option for auth_token middleware.

The keystone auth_token middleware expects an option named
'signing_dir'.  The sample api-paste.ini file for nova defined
'signing_dirname' instead.

Fix bug 1073858.

Change-Id: Ie9a3df73a8d9d52b48d6e0bcce0aae762af929a9
"}]
commit_message:
Fix signing_dir option for auth_token middleware.

The keystone auth_token middleware expects an option named
'signing_dir'.  The sample api-paste.ini file for nova defined
'signing_dirname' instead.

Fix bug 1073858.

Change-Id: Ie9a3df73a8d9d52b48d6e0bcce0aae762af929a9

'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-11-02 19:34:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 100, 'date': '2012-11-02 19:43:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I made some changes to the original patch to help resolve the RPCAPI semantics issues.

Part of the problem is a mix of terminology. For instance, we have stop compute.API.stop, which calls compute.manager.stop_instance, which then calls power_off_instance.

The changes I've made will hopefully allow us to get a point where we use consistent terminology within nova.

This patch renames power_off_instance to soft_delete_instance and keeps power_off_instance around for upgrade compatibility. (Same with power_on_instance and restore_instance).

After grizzly, we can then rename stop_instance to power_off_instance (and start_instance to power_on_instance). At that point, we'll have consistent naming between the API and the hypervisor drivers.

This patch also uses task_states.POWERING_OFF consistently instead of a mix of STOPPING and POWERING_OFF. The STOPPING and STARTING task_states can be removed after grizzly as well."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-02 19:55:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Detangle soft delete and power off

Soft deletes are implemented by using the power_off compute method.
Unfortunately, this limits what a hypervisor driver can do to the
minimum expected from powering off an instance.

Change-Id: I577a58473885dcc8a586a0829752e8397424bc02

HTTPClient now supports a retries argument. It will reissue requests
for any 5xx or socket (400 with n/a) errors. This retry loop was
"inspired" by swiftclient's loop. It reauths one time if necessary.
It uses backoff times of 1, 2, 4... seconds.

The default is 0 retries. It is also exposed to the shell as well with
a --retries arg.

Change-Id: I75d9a13d6c4ba16a5da13d4bf5cad78a777d67d7

commit_message:
Add retries to cinderclient.

HTTPClient now supports a retries argument. It will reissue requests
for any 5xx or socket (400 with n/a) errors. This retry loop was
"inspired" by swiftclient's loop. It reauths one time if necessary.
It uses backoff times of 1, 2, 4... seconds.

The default is 0 retries. It is also exposed to the shell as well with
a --retries arg.

Change-Id: I75d9a13d6c4ba16a5da13d4bf5cad78a777d67d7

was updated to include additional 'virtapi' arg
required and our tests do not pass any args to
it therefore breaking them. dansmith recommended
to change fake.FakeDriver to Fake.FakeVirtAPI
which will replicate the old functionality.

"}]
commit_message:
nova fake libvirt library breaking tests

fixes bug #1074488 Nova libvirt fake library
was updated to include additional 'virtapi' arg
required and our tests do not pass any args to
it therefore breaking them. dansmith recommended
to change fake.FakeDriver to Fake.FakeVirtAPI
which will replicate the old functionality.

Change-Id: Iedcd32cd038c6043d782565312adf5fcba8d9b7a

commit_message:
re-use headers_to_container_info on container GET

Currently, a container's info can be cached without cors data intact after
a container GET.

I made headers_to_container_info a function instead of a method and I crammed
all container metadata into container_info.
This is so e.g. staticweb can eventually re-use the same container info cache.

Fix pep8 in swift/proxy/controllers/container.py

Change-Id: I4bbb042dde79afac48395efc38bd80f0ff240e1f

[{'created': '2012-10-21 17:14:11.000000000', 'message': "Delete last copy after it's restored to the original container in object-expirer

Fix bug 1067677

When we delete a versioned object, the last version will be poped out from the versiones container.
When a versioned object is expired and deleted by object-expirer, the last version is restored but remains in the versions container instead of getting deleted.
The reason is object-expirer will set 'X-If-Delete-At' header when deleteing an object. However this is for the current version - not for the last version. When the object-server is trying to delete the last version, the transaction will fail with error: X-If-Delete-At and X-Delete-At do not match.
Delete the 'X-If-Delete-At' field in the later built delete request would help to solve this issue.

Change-Id: I62c97e6a0f140888497e189129825865fb6f7966

commit_message:
Allow object-expirer to delete the last version of an object

Fix bug 1067677

When we delete a versioned object, the last version will be poped out from the
versiones container. When a versioned object is expired and deleted by object-
expirer, the last version is restored but remains in the versions container
instead of getting deleted. The reason is object-expirer will set
'X-If-Delete- At' header when deleteing an object. However this is for the
current version - not for the last version. When the object-server is trying
to delete the last version, the transaction will fail with error:
X-If-Delete-At and X-Delete-At do not match. Delete the 'X-If-Delete-At'
field in the later built delete request would help to solve this issue.

This patch, without the test, was first proposed by
Zhou Yuan <yuan.zhou@intel.com>.

Change-Id: I62c97e6a0f140888497e189129825865fb6f7966

[{'created': '2012-11-02 18:29:40.000000000', 'message': "Make multipart/byteranges boundary always length 32.

Due to a lack of zero-padding in a format string, there was a 1/16
chance that the length of the randomly-generated boundary string was
less than 32. This didn't affect client downloads, but it did give the
unit tests a 1/16 chance of failing (there's a [0-9a-f]{32} regex in a
test).

Now we left-zero-pad the boundary string to length 32, and the test
consistently passes.

Change-Id: I4ee98dab127e5674e59b078d8090470ec783e0b0
"}]
commit_message:
Make multipart/byteranges boundary always length 32.

Due to a lack of zero-padding in a format string, there was a 1/16
chance that the length of the randomly-generated boundary string was
less than 32. This didn't affect client downloads, but it did give the
unit tests a 1/16 chance of failing (there's a [0-9a-f]{32} regex in a
test).

Now we left-zero-pad the boundary string to length 32, and the test
consistently passes.

Change-Id: I4ee98dab127e5674e59b078d8090470ec783e0b0

commit_message:
dispersion report option to output missing parts

Adds a -p option to swift-dispersion-report that will output the
partitions missing copies to standard error. Another thing we've been
meaning to add for forever. It's useful when you want to do some
further research on whether a partition truly has fewer copies or if
they're just somewhere else in the cluster due to a ring change, for
instance.

DocImpact

Change-Id: I5e47aa5818483ecc34b39ef6f8cd83ad312ed9a0

commit_message:
Update sqlalchemy version

One of the other projects uses a newer version of
SQLAlchemy than we do, so upgrade to avoid installation
conflicts, especially with devstack.

Change-Id: Icd4db279bc34d98e11ce36e92180c578c7947fa1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

The iframe for the noVNC console is too small for some users who
like to use GUI on the console.  Leaving the sizes off completely
and letting the browser figure it out causes hilarity to ensue, so
explicitly set the height and width to quasi-sensible values.

Also, the "unavailable" error says "unavailabe"  Fixed.

commit_message:
Dynamically size the noVNC iframe, fix typos in copy

The iframe for the noVNC console is too small for some users who
like to use GUI on the console.  Leaving the sizes off completely
and letting the browser figure it out causes hilarity to ensue, so
explicitly set the height and width to quasi-sensible values.

Also, the "unavailable" error says "unavailabe"  Fixed.

Fixes Bug 1050316 ?

Addendum:

add an identifier to the iframe rather than using the auto-generated selector

Change-Id: I17cfa97cdc69f4b58e18d02451da2197c663e0d3

One question inline about something which was done post-fork in children worker processes vs now only in the parent pre-fork.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2012-10-24 17:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: (1 inline comment)

Previously, loadapp was called once at the beginning, than once again for every green thread. The current commit changes this to calling loadapp only once prior to starting the green threads. Is there any reason to return to the old way of calling it twice?'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-10-24 23:03:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

That's my question exactly: does this change hurt anything?  But it's worth noting that run_server() is invoked in "children workers" which are unix processes forked off, not greenthreads.

I'd expect that if there was no difference, then the existing code would have just saved off the result of loadapp() and used it inside run_server()...'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-10-25 20:52:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Ah, unfortunately the exact reason for the after-fork loadapp has been lost to time. :( I should've made a better commit message.

The early loadapp is to verify configuration before all the forking -- fail fast.

The last loadapp would be because most code is written thinking it will be initialized and run within the same process and you could have weird side effects with a fork between __init__ and actual usage.

To me, the after-fork loadapp would be more important than the pre-fork one, but the pre-fork is useful when there's a configuration error so you get to it faster and don't have it repeat umpteen times."}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-10-25 21:16:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'd feel more comfortable with the loadapp() call whose result is actually used continuing to happen post-fork."}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2012-10-25 21:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

There is no reason to repeat initialization post fork.

Still, the overhead in repeating it i neglectable, and there seem to be a concern that something will not work otherwise, so I will put it back.'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2012-10-25 21:35:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 2696, 'date': '2012-10-25 21:54:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)

one comment inline'}, {'account_id': 4108, 'date': '2012-10-25 22:03:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: (1 inline comment)
