commit_message:
Freeze pip versions to those used at release time

Rather than allowing the stable branch to be subject to unpredictable
breakages caused by newer versions of libraries appearing in pypi,
freeze our requirement versions to those versions we would have used
at release time.

Change-Id: Iac595c0ac10ea1306d35368c12a9b84f12222528

As discussed here:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-November/002068.html

We want to freeze versions of libraries in pip-requires on the stable
branch so as to avoid being subject to random breakages for new
versions. We should mostly only be dealing with such things on the

Change-Id: Ifc53ca1852eb749175d58b2fb5ed9cfed6b4b0e5
'}]
commit_message:
Add a script for freezing pip-requires versions

As discussed here:

  http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-November/002068.html

We want to freeze versions of libraries in pip-requires on the stable
branch so as to avoid being subject to random breakages for new
versions. We should mostly only be dealing with such things on the
master branch.

Change-Id: Ifc53ca1852eb749175d58b2fb5ed9cfed6b4b0e5

commit_message:
Don't log exceptions for GreenletExit and thread_done

1) Greenletexit is normal so don't log it.

2) logging in a linked callback is just asking for problems.
   (we don't want to cause a context switch in this callback).

Change-Id: Ia9bb1cabc65a742fc49beb379548eb680b326e58

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-29 23:58:47.000000000', 'message': "Detect and fix issues caused by vol ID migration

The migration from volume ID to UUID neglected to update the provider_location
field on the volume.  As a result the iqn and volume name no long match and
existing volumes are no longer able to be attached after an upgrade
(essex -> folsom and then nova-vol->cinder).

This patch adds a method to the volume driver that will check for the
mismatch of volume name in the iqn during service start up.  If
detected it will update the provider_location field in the database
to include the new ID.  Also it will create a symlink to the device backing
file that also has the correct naming convention.

Note: We don't disturb an connections that are currently attached.
For this case we add a check in manager.detach and do any provider_location
cleanup that's needed at that time.  This ensures that connections
persist on restarts of tgtd and reboot.

Change-Id: Ib41ebdc849ebc31a9225bdc4902209c5a23da104
Fixes: bug 1065702
"}, {'created': '2012-10-30 05:46:28.000000000', 'message': "Detect and fix issues caused by vol ID migration

commit_message:
Detect and fix issues caused by vol ID migration

The migration from volume ID to UUID neglected to update the provider_location
field on the volume.  As a result the iqn and volume name no long match and
existing volumes are no longer able to be attached after an upgrade
(essex -> folsom and then nova-vol->cinder).

This patch adds a method to the volume driver that will check for the
mismatch of volume name in the iqn during service start up.  If
detected it will update the provider_location field in the database
to include the new ID.  Also it will create a symlink to the device backing
file that also has the correct naming convention.

Note: We don't disturb an connections that are currently attached.
For this case we add a check in manager.detach and do any provider_location
cleanup that's needed at that time.  This ensures that connections
persist on restarts of tgtd and reboot.

Change-Id: Ib41ebdc849ebc31a9225bdc4902209c5a23da104
Fixes: bug 1065702

commit_message:
Get subnets of router interfaces with an elevated context.

Fixes bug 1057558

A router may have interfaces owned by other tenants (by admin operations).
An elevated context is required to get subnet information for such interfaces.

Change-Id: Iaf24c842c2c1e3c52573e7f9831d5f6d8fc01885

commit_message:
Fix TypeError from old-style publish_counter calls

Fix calls to publish_counter() that didn't specify the source
explicitly, to avoid the following error since the function
signature has changed:

  TypeError: publish_counter() takes exactly 5 arguments (4 given)

Change-Id: Ief05842be7b9c815a60827f6356f9064fef8182c
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Use new Parameters class for validation

The Stack.validate() method is no longer used for the validate_template
feature (since it requires the parameter values in order to parse the whole
template), so move the code for outputting parameter metadata to where it
is actually used.

Change-Id: Ibf2ad7cb485bff75953c952f34ea4a597ea5e2f8
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Separate Parameters implementation from Properties

There are only 3 types allowed for Parameters (String, Number and
CommaDelimitedList), but we are currently allowing more due to a shared
implementation with Properties (which is an internal implementation
detail). This creates a separate implementation for Parameters with only
the allowed types.

Change-Id: If51ec538893a582da2caa0356c25e515e9d8004e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-31 22:44:03.000000000', 'message': "Detect and fix issues caused by vol ID migration

The migration from volume ID to UUID neglected to update the provider_location
field on the volume.  As a result the iqn and volume name no long match and
existing volumes are no longer able to be attached after an upgrade
(essex -> folsom and then nova-vol->cinder).

This patch adds a method to the volume driver that will check for the
mismatch of volume name in the iqn during service start up.  If
detected it will update the provider_location field in the database
to include the new ID.  Also it will create a symlink to the device backing
file that also has the correct naming convention.

Note: We don't disturb an connections that are currently attached.
For this case we add a check in manager.detach and do any provider_location
cleanup that's needed at that time.  This ensures that connections
persist on restarts of tgtd and reboot.

Change-Id: I4683df4ef489972752dc58cb4e91d458a79a8ef2
Fixes: bug 1065702enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting
"}]
commit_message:
Detect and fix issues caused by vol ID migration

The migration from volume ID to UUID neglected to update the provider_location
field on the volume.  As a result the iqn and volume name no long match and
existing volumes are no longer able to be attached after an upgrade
(essex -> folsom and then nova-vol->cinder).

This patch adds a method to the volume driver that will check for the
mismatch of volume name in the iqn during service start up.  If
detected it will update the provider_location field in the database
to include the new ID.  Also it will create a symlink to the device backing
file that also has the correct naming convention.

Note: We don't disturb an connections that are currently attached.
For this case we add a check in manager.detach and do any provider_location
cleanup that's needed at that time.  This ensures that connections
persist on restarts of tgtd and reboot.

Change-Id: I4683df4ef489972752dc58cb4e91d458a79a8ef2
Fixes: bug 1065702enter the commit message for your changes. Lines starting

Hi,
Some minor nits.
I am asking myself why the creation is treated differently from the update. That is, in the creation the gateway can be part of the allocation pool. I feel that the update should be the same. I do not see any reason why the gateway should not be allowed to be part of the allocation pool. If the IP address is used then we should fail, if not then the it should succeed and the allocation range updated accordingly.
That is my two cents.
Thanks

commit_message:
Add check for subnet update with conflict gateway and allocation_pools

Fixes bug 1062061

The patch will raise exception 'GatewayConflictWithAllocationPools' when
subnet update with conflict gateway and allocation_pools.

Because before validate gateway ip with conflict allocation pools, we need
validate allocation pools first. Move the validation of allocation pools
into _validate_subnet. Then_allocate_pools_for_subnet is only responsible
for pools allocation, and_validate_subnet is responsible for most validate
for subnet.

Change-Id: Ib445970df8f6ff856cafc39309814fbe5cf0c3b5

messages:
[{'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-22 20:57:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Does this also needs a new migration to set utf8 for installs that have already upgraded? Or will this universally fail unless the db is already set to utf8 by default?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-22 21:13:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/14617/1/check/gate-nova-merge/10241 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/14617/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/1754 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-10-23 18:01:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I'm a bit confused by this one actually. The patch looks fine and probably won't break anything but we aren't setting mysql_charset in other places either and based on your finding here that worries me.

If you've previously installed your database with migrations then you should already have this set in your Nova schema:

"ALTER DATABASE %s DEFAULT CHARACTER SET utf8;"

So the question I have is why is your database not using UTF8 as a default character. 

For reference you can also look at the code in 077_convert_to_utf8.py from Essex. This migration is what initially caused some of the upgrade issues in Essex -> Folsom. Sounds like we are still dealing with fallout?'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-10-24 12:03:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

-1 to get a more complete commit message, please follow the guidelines here - http://wiki.openstack.org/GitCommitMessages

There is a lot of context in the bug, which really should be in the log message to understand why we're contemplating changing a migration (which is typically a no no).

Following the conversation on the bug, it seems like the issue is that there was a dump / restore in the middle of the mix. So the global default for the openstack database, which is actually on system tables in mysql, weren't reestablished.

It opens the question on protecting against that scenario. Given that I don't think it hurts anything else, I think the approach is probably sane, but really do need to explain this more in the commit message."}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-10-24 14:52:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

What about databases that failed the migration I think you still need to do the migration properly."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-01 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Allow the user to update a volume's metadata

The fix mainly involves updating the VolumeController's update method
to allow the 'metadata' key to be a valid key in a request body.

The _translate_volume_summary_view method is updated to check for a
'metadata' key in the vol parameter after checking first for
'volume_metadata'.  This is to avoid making a third call to the
database after updating the volume model.  This solution introduces
the least amount of new code.

Change-Id: I41256d03f9c4c7a0866ff0f2d35fce8e4fd26b11
Fixes: bug #1046382

I'd agree with Eric, swap the log level to debug and I think it's good to go.  Useful add, thanks!"}, {'account_id': 2515, 'date': '2012-10-29 20:52:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for the feed back!

Typical REST "actions" are found in the URL and logged for audit as info() messages. (See line 785) This situation differs in that the /action resource hides the desired 'action' in the body of the post.  This patch was an attempt to expose the 'actions' to the info level.

commit_message:
Log the body of an /action

The inability to deduce an /action request from the logs
makes diagnosing integration with nova difficult. This change
logs the action method and arguments

Change-Id: Iea4f46c7da9c61e07aa23e897b60992b8fdb6663

Update vif driver of Ryu plugin

Fixes bug 1059393

This patch allows Ryu plugin to be compatible with Nova Security Groups.

[{'created': '2012-10-31 23:28:51.000000000', 'message': "Fix compute api test verification of block dev info

In a recent no-db-compute patch, I moved where block device info
was fetched from the database, and then modified the tests
accordingly. However, instead of testing what *should* have been
generated, I tested was *was* being generated. Thus, fail.

This patch fixes that, on top of Vish's fix of the actual issue.

Change-Id: Id175751f8ddf9d16209f45216f738b58595e7e38
"}]
commit_message:
Fix compute api test verification of block dev info

In a recent no-db-compute patch, I moved where block device info
was fetched from the database, and then modified the tests
accordingly. However, instead of testing what *should* have been
generated, I tested was *was* being generated. Thus, fail.

This patch fixes that, on top of Vish's fix of the actual issue.

Change-Id: Id175751f8ddf9d16209f45216f738b58595e7e38

[{'created': '2012-10-25 23:16:02.000000000', 'message': 'Remove duplicate api_paste_config setting.

Remove duplicate api_paste_config setting.

nova/tests/fake_flags.py does not need to set the api_paste_config
option twice. Remove the duplicate entry.

commit_message:
Don't enable osapi_volume if n-vol not enabled.

Enabling cinder removes osapi_volume from enabled_apis in nova.conf but
if neither cinder or n-vol are enabled it should not be there.  It seems
that volume code is being removed from nova so osapi_volume should not
be enabled by default.

Fixes bug #1073701

Change-Id: I626a941f434b1c8c1a73b32318e21c99445b5541

Yes, currently that connection is lost.  But, I think I can deal with this by adding a persistence file for the actively attached iqn during volume startup after migration.

My only concern is then I've got two targets for the same volume.  I was considering a method in detach that looked for the *old* iqn persist file and removed it.  Maybe that would work."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-10-28 17:37:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

So I think the best solution is:
1. Update the provider location in startup for those volumes not in use.
2. For those that are in use, create the persist file using the old style iqn (so the connection is restored on reboot or tgt restart)
3. Fix up the old style/in-use volumes on detach and remove the old style persist link

Testing this seems to be what I want, I'll clean up the code and submit it unless there are objections between now and tomorrow.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-24 22:30:10.000000000', 'message': 'Detect and fix issues caused by vol ID migration

The migration from volume ID to UUID neglected to update the provider_location
field on the volume.  As a result the iqn and volume name no long match and
existing volumes are no longer able to be attached after an upgrade
(essex -> folsom and then nova-vol->cinder).

This patch adds a method to the volume driver that will check for the
mismatch of volume name in the iqn during service start up.  If
detected it will update the provider_location field in the database
to include the new ID.  Also it will create a symlink to the device backing
file that also has the correct naming convention.

Change-Id: I8224824b793c98a9767c5d8dd741d892be720c4f
Fixes: bug 1065702

commit_message:
Detect and fix issues caused by vol ID migration

The migration from volume ID to UUID neglected to update the provider_location
field on the volume.  As a result the iqn and volume name no long match and
existing volumes are no longer able to be attached after an upgrade
(essex -> folsom and then nova-vol->cinder).

This patch adds a method to the volume driver that will check for the
mismatch of volume name in the iqn during service start up.  If
detected it will update the provider_location field in the database
to include the new ID.  Also it will create a symlink to the device backing
file that also has the correct naming convention.

Note: We don't disturb an connections that are currently attached.
For this case we add a check in manager.detach and do any provider_location
cleanup that's needed at that time.  This ensures that connections
persist on restarts of tgtd and reboot.

Change-Id: I8224824b793c98a9767c5d8dd741d892be720c4f
Fixes: bug 1065702

subject: Adding volume owner (project) to admin table.
messages:
[{'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-10-30 22:56:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This depends on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15070/ !

This presents the information Horizon is given through the API, but it brings up an important question: why do instances present 'Project Name' and volumes the 'Project ID'? This is a silly difference and we should probably standardize on one or the other. Do you think we should map the tenant id returned with volumes to tenant names?"}, {'account_id': 1816, 'date': '2012-10-30 22:59:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

If you look at what's happening for the instances table, you'll notice that the API is *not* returning the name, and it's a pain in the ass. Horizon wants to display the human-readable names for everything, which means we end up having to query the projects list all the time just to get the names.

This is why I go on and on about APIs having the capability to serialize multiple layers of data (e.g. give me the project, not just it's ID).

Overall if we're gonna do this we should do it all the way and make it the name."}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-10-30 23:02:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Yeah, I should have looked into how the servers table was doing it first. I see what needs doing. I'll do that meow."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-30 23:16:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

commit_message:
move nova.common.deprecated to openstack-common

Fixes bug #1070511

nova has a common deprecation path which lets you turn
deprecation warnings into fatal errors via config. Make
this a function of the openstack common log to make it
available to other projects in a standard way.

Include exception directly in logging module.

Update exception to work correctly now that it's not
based off of nova's exception class.

Change-Id: I699e776c99c429e60dfb5cd6c0cdbb661bae0ce8

I think _extract_metadata is awkward.  "if metadatum.find('=') > -1:" should just be "if '=' in metadata".  (metadatum is an excellent variable name though.)  Also, you could avoid initializing metadata at the top of the function and just say metadata = {key: value} at the end, to make it clear that it's always a single-key dict.

The list comprehension in test_list_types works but doesn't really convey the intent of the code, since you're building a list just to throw it away. commit_message:
Add volume_type extra_specs support to client

Adds ability to set/clear volume_type extra_specs
via python-cinderclient.

* Adds extra_specs info to the list-types output
* Adds missing tests for volume_types features
* Fixes unset loop so it actually iterates through all of the supplied keys

Change-Id: I3552de722f76389cfef6d4f12320720e022ebfac

Fixes Bug #1073547

Nova scheduler's ImagePropertiesFilter based filtering requires the
"supported_instances" stat returned by the driver's get_host_stats method.
This fix implements the get_host_stats method, providing also some
refactoring in the process by adding a HostOps class.

Change-Id: Ia6e73eb3e8ff0be028854fe4fd6d8e305fa1d504
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes hypervisor based image filtering on Hyper-V

Fixes Bug #1073547

Nova scheduler's ImagePropertiesFilter based filtering requires the
"supported_instances" stat returned by the driver's get_host_stats method.
This fix implements the get_host_stats method, providing also some
refactoring in the process by adding a HostOps class.

Change-Id: Ia6e73eb3e8ff0be028854fe4fd6d8e305fa1d504

This patch removes the dead instance cleanup from the
init_host() method in the PowerVM driver. Not only do

in compute_manager(), it's also examining the instance
task_state, which I think is a layering violation.

Tangentially related to bp/no-db-compute

Change-Id: Ie7eb4c07caa162f32021ccdbed51db950d30e2c7

This patch removes the dead instance cleanup from the
init_host() method in the PowerVM driver. Not only do
I think that it's redundant with the rest of init_host()
in compute_manager(), it's also examining the instance

Change-Id: Ie7eb4c07caa162f32021ccdbed51db950d30e2c7

commit_message:
Remove redundant code from PowerVM driver

This patch removes the dead instance cleanup from the
init_host() method in the PowerVM driver. Not only do
I think that it's redundant with the rest of init_host()
in compute_manager(), it's also examining the instance
task_state, which I think is a layering violation.

Tangentially related to bp/no-db-compute

Change-Id: Ie7eb4c07caa162f32021ccdbed51db950d30e2c7

commit_message:
Updated keystone CLI options

- Updated --os-token/--os-endpoint options
- Replaced underscores with hyphens
- Removed hashed password from user-create response
- Removed explicit --enabled=true (which is the default behavior)
- Removed null values from CLI output, which are no longer rendered

Change-Id: I14544a00017c3f8e51cfd018fcbc12e6a3257011

Expose the ID of the project to which a volume belongs through a
new API extension. This is only presented to Admins by default.
Visibility can be controlled with the 'volume_tenant_attribute'
policy rule.

Change-Id: If85d9759af6a9457bf3230375cc64af9efe4a088
"}]
commit_message:
Add VolumeTenantAttribute API extension

Expose the ID of the project to which a volume belongs through a
new API extension. This is only presented to Admins by default.
Visibility can be controlled with the 'volume_tenant_attribute'
policy rule.

Change-Id: If85d9759af6a9457bf3230375cc64af9efe4a088

[{'created': '2012-10-26 14:33:36.000000000', 'message': "Ignore keystone.openstack for PEP8

tox.ini already ignores keystone.openstack, so run_tests.sh should as
well.

- Fixed: No files were being ignored
- Removed non-existent files from ignored list
- Using commas to seperate ignored files

  Colons didn't work at all for me, and the pep8 man page illustrates
  the use of commas.

Change-Id: Icd260ba5c0fa37040f66d1f913fc7940d69eda68
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore keystone.openstack for PEP8

tox.ini already ignores keystone.openstack, so run_tests.sh should as
well.

- Fixed: No files were being ignored
- Removed non-existent files from ignored list
- Using commas to seperate ignored files

  Colons didn't work at all for me, and the pep8 man page illustrates
  the use of commas.

Change-Id: Icd260ba5c0fa37040f66d1f913fc7940d69eda68

commit_message:
pin sqlalchemy to 0.7

Fixes bug #1073569

commit_message:
pin sqlalchemy to the 0.7 series

sqlalchemy 0.8 beta has hit mirrors, and changes dependencies, thus
breaking jenkins. This pins it to 0.7 series until all the projects
agree to move forward to 0.8.

Fixes bug #1073569

Change-Id: I7b13ef48730e6499442a4a2a9d28b59e0121acf0

You modified match() to take a variable number of env variables but the other two methods won't suppport that."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-30 18:58:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

I got curious and did some digging.  The issue is with get_command() and get_environment().  get_command() is passing dnsmasq as an argument because it's now position 4 instead of 3.

Because match() now supports a variable number of env variables you'll probably need to search for 'dnsmasq' and append everything after in get_command().

get_envronment() should probably use a similar loop to match(), check for '=', up to 'dnsmasq'."}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2012-10-30 19:51:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Use env to set environ when starting dnsmasq

Explictly use env to setup needed environment variables for dnsmasq when
starting to avoid problems with subprocess mis-interpreting the first
command line argument as the executable name.

Also update DnsmasqFilter to accept any command that starts with env
followed by a set of args that include an equals sign, as long as the
next arg is the dnsmasq command.

fixes bug #1073253

Change-Id: I8ac08ba2d2309934a67ed2cb28049ed5d3277d63

commit_message:
Add scheduler retries for prep_resize operations.

Retry operations are subject to race conditions for compute resources.
prep_resize can race for resources on the destination host and
revert_resize can race for resources on the original source host.
This type of problem is handled for new instance build requests
by the resource tracker in compute.

As a first step to extending the resource tracker to cover resizes,
this patch adds scheduler retries around the prep_resize operation.

bug 1065267

Change-Id: I1b32c0a282772d9580e322b50990932016058329

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-31 18:08:58.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a way to disable some plugins

Provide configuration options for the three plugin sets
users may want to manage (compute pollsters, central
pollsters, and notification listeners).

Extend the plugin API so the extension manager can ask
each plugin if it should be enabled. This allows, for
example, the libvirt pollster to be loaded but then
recognize that it should not be used and disable itself.

Change-Id: I82da823845ec49c1a93272411c43073bd4954377
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>
'}, {'created': '2012-10-31 18:08:58.000000000', 'message': 'Provide a way to disable some plugins

users may want to manage (compute pollsters, central
pollsters, and notification listeners).

Extend the plugin API so the extension manager can ask
each plugin if it should be enabled. This allows, for
example, the libvirt pollster to be loaded but then
recognize that it should not be used and disable itself.

Addresses bug #1021350

commit_message:
Provide a way to disable some plugins

Provide configuration options for the three plugin sets
users may want to manage (compute pollsters, central
pollsters, and notification listeners).

Extend the plugin API so the extension manager can ask
each plugin if it should be enabled. This allows, for
example, the libvirt pollster to be loaded but then
recognize that it should not be used and disable itself.

Addresses bug #1021350

Change-Id: I82da823845ec49c1a93272411c43073bd4954377
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

[{'created': '2012-10-30 19:37:41.000000000', 'message': 'Validate that boolean parameters are boolean

Ensure that values which are supposed to be boolean look like correct
user input, instead of assuming that any non true-looking input is
False.

Also, update the flavor manager to raise a CommandError if is_public is
not a boolean value.

Fixes bug 1059414

Change-Id: I3275e4bba103b14081becf91f723f1be060391e5
'}]
commit_message:
Validate that boolean parameters are boolean

Ensure that values which are supposed to be boolean look like correct
user input, instead of assuming that any non true-looking input is
False.

Also, update the flavor manager to raise a CommandError if is_public is
not a boolean value.

Fixes bug 1059414

Change-Id: I3275e4bba103b14081becf91f723f1be060391e5

commit_message:
Use stevedore to load all plugins

Move away from calling pkg_resources directly to use
stevedore to load plugins. This lays the ground work
for handling disabled plugins during the loading
phase.

addresses bug #1021350

Change-Id: I94c2d0da2a6f9222611716b96455104a71564f29
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Add call to reset quota usage

There are certain circumstances where we may need to indicate an
uncertainty in a user's current usage of a given resource, thus
forcing a recount of those resources currently in use.  This adds
a QUOTAS.usage_reset() call which can be used to do this.  It
works by resetting the current usage to -1, which will force the
usage record to be refreshed the next time that user reserves
those resources.

Change-Id: I4a40c8edcc78ed9a7d18a293d4d7d6418b04b7f2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-31 17:33:03.000000000', 'message': 'heat-keystone-setup : fix error on folsom first-install

When running heat-keystone-setup for the first time after (re)installing
openstack folsom, it fails, because the user-role-list is running *as* the
heat user, not reading the roles assigned to the heat user, which fails
because on a new install the heat user does not have the admin role.
Using the credentials from the environment means we run the command as
admin, but --user_id selects the roles for the heat user.

Change-Id: Ib2733e63f664d75be1e2e3bd43038bbd1dbebde8
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
heat-keystone-setup : fix error on folsom first-install

When running heat-keystone-setup for the first time after (re)installing
openstack folsom, it fails, because the user-role-list is running *as* the
heat user, not reading the roles assigned to the heat user, which fails
because on a new install the heat user does not have the admin role.
Using the credentials from the environment means we run the command as
admin, but --user_id selects the roles for the heat user.

Change-Id: Ib2733e63f664d75be1e2e3bd43038bbd1dbebde8
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Force earlier version of sqlalchemy

Set the version of sqlalchemy to be earlier than the 0.8 beta as it
is incompatible with the latest available sqlalchemy-migrate and as
a result run_tests.sh does not run any tests.

Change-Id: I9c5515b76d35e4999f81d71e82f818685efe54ea
(cherry picked from commit 117db792b80e1280135603d26e042bc4a17e02c2)

commit_message:
Clean up xenapi VM records on failed disk attaches

Breaks the create_vm_step up so that we can clean up the VM record in
case of disk attach failures.

Fixes bug 1073219

Change-Id: I54e28e2cce6fe4f29a03566eff998479410f7555

commit_message:
Fixes hypervisor based image filtering on Hyper-V

Fixes Bug #1073547

Nova scheduler's ImagePropertiesFilter based filtering requires the
"supported_instances" stat returned by the driver's get_host_stats method.
This fix implements the get_host_stats method, providing also some
refactoring in the process by adding a HostOps class.

Change-Id: I205a020f1c2dc00118a6e5e619da8c553a1efd15

commit_message:
pin sqlalchemy to 0.7

The sqlalchemy package 0.8.0b1 released on October 30, 2012
removed SQLSoup

(http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/changelog/migration_08.html#sqlsoup)

Ensure that the SqlSoup import is still supported. A number of quantum agents
make use of this code to access the database.

Fixes bug 1073555

Change-Id: I78b27716c6e3eb05d874314f0bc544a917fd5853

commit_message:
pin sqlalchemy to the 0.7 series

sqlalchemy 0.8 beta has hit mirrors, and changes dependencies, thus
breaking jenkins. This pins it to 0.7 series until all the projects
agree to move forward to 0.8.

Fixes bug #1073569

Change-Id: If11f39d311ba9ef5cb2b198c9649a8997b2a52b5

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-31 12:27:12.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Ok, before we remove this code, let's make sure we understand why it was needed in the first place

It was merged by this: https://code.launchpad.net/~jk0/nova/backup_with_rotation/+merge/65835

That's commit 5caef3c927

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5caef3c9/nova/compute/manager.py#L569
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/5caef3c9/nova/image/glance.py#L101
https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/ac332926/glance/client.py#L72

So, it looks like Nova never passes the 'limit' param to glance in this version of the code. Why then is the code to deal with batches of results? It's because glance itself returns a maximum of 25 images at a time:

https://github.com/openstack/glance/blob/ac332926a5/glance/registry/server.py#L47

The thing that has changed since then is that glanceclient's list() method now returns a generator which includes the full list of images so you never need to explicitly page through them:

https://github.com/openstack/python-glanceclient/blob/a8e88aa/glanceclient/v1/images.py#L115"}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-10-31 12:32:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-24 16:10:18.000000000', 'message': "fetch_images() method no more needed

The Nova Glance wrapper returns all images metadata
if the parameter 'limit' is not define. It doesn't
split the image metadata list.

So the sub method fetch_image is no more needed.
We can delete it.

I added a check in Nova Glance wrapper to be sure
the parameter 'marker' or another one aren't set
to 'None' (like in bug #1065053).

Fixes LP bug #1065053

commit_message:
fetch_images() method no more needed

The Nova Glance wrapper returns all images metadata
if the parameter 'limit' is not define. It doesn't
split the image metadata list.

So the sub method fetch_image is no more needed.
We can delete it.

I added a check in Nova Glance wrapper to be sure
the parameter 'marker' or another one aren't set
to 'None' (like in bug #1065053).

Fixes LP bug #1070904

Change-Id: I24ecc4adf158401f60b508aa3a20bd4c91bfa92b

commit_message:
pin sqlalchemy to 0.7

sqlalchemy 0.8.0b1 breaks some dependencies such as sqlalchemy-migrate, pin the version until we fix them

Fixes bug #1073569

Change-Id: I6620276bf8f0a7cbc1d51aa226cd33c512e59a48

commit_message:
Delete VNC token after server deletion.

This fix deletes the token associated with the 'host' and 'port' upon instance
deletion and live migration.
As memcache does not support fetching data based on value, this fix is
currently implemented only for Nova's memorycache implementation.

Fixes LP: #1058077

Change-Id: Icc391caa6f540f4f8a9e8e67cb126259faaec71f

commit_message:
Force earlier version of sqlalchemy

Set the version of sqlalchemy to be earlier than the 0.8 beta as it
is incompatible with the latest available sqlalchemy-migrate and as
a result run_tests.sh does not run any tests.

Change-Id: I90c9cf1d8187c75ff08c204856433c4dd6f832a3

commit_message:
Remove nose detailed error reporting.

Nosetests' detailed error reporting breaks when running testtools tests.
Disable this plugin to get proper error reporting.

Change-Id: I4898f567e8588e1dd61940486dfc515e459adc34

commit_message:
set tox to ignore global packages

Ran into problems with Ming and stevedore
which tox will look at the global installed
pkg instead of the virtualenv pkg

Change-Id: Ie1a834dce51fc916f1f3c3c1abd95d080ff1c9cd

Should we just remove all of the duplicate functionality that's in the manager and do it all in API then?

(Actually, I'd really prefer we split nova-compute at the driver layer...  top layer listens on general topic and handles driver/host independent stuff like this... and then calls to lower level daemon to do driver/host specific stuff.  Then we can just go back to casting deletes to this higher level daemon)"}, {'account_id': 1678, 'date': '2012-10-26 06:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

some inline comments'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-10-26 23:06:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (3 inline comments)

Responses inline.  New version coming soon.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-10-26 23:08:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Chris, I like your proposal, but this patch is trying to address a bug (and hopefully a backport to Folsom).  So I think your proposal should be considered outside the scope of this patch.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-10-26 23:15:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-26 23:36:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

nova volume-create
nova attach-volume

mysql nova -e "update instances set host="foo" where host=<hostname>;"
mysql nova -e "update floating_ips set host="foo" where host=<hostname>;"

nova delete

verify floating ip is disassociated
verify volume is disassociated

commit_message:
Fix VM deletion from down compute node

* free network resources
* free volume resources
* delete.start and delete.stop notifications added
* Handle network deallocate in multi_host mode

Fixes bug 1067214

Co-authored-by: Vishvananda Ishaya <vishvananda@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I0d4a7dc5836d39e405824528de214f23b214849f

is incompatible with the latest available sqlalchemy-migrate and as

commit_message:
Force earlier version of sqlalchemy

Set the version of sqlalchemy to be earlier than the 0.8 beta as it
is incompatible with the latest available sqlalchemy-migrate and as
a result run_tests.sh does not run any tests.

Change-Id: I9c5515b76d35e4999f81d71e82f818685efe54ea

Hey James, this is a good change and we need something like this.  There are a couple of concerns, the first being API versioning.  I think we can deal with that because it's adding data to the return without changing signature of the API.

The bigger problem however is we don't necessarily want to expose the host information to the end users.  We've talked about creating a UUID representation for the volume host.  I'd like to go that route, so we'd need to implement that piece then make some tweaks to this patch to use it."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-22 23:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I would suggest using the same method that compute uses for generating an opaque host identifier:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/views/servers.py#L152

(probably needs to be an extension though)'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-22 23:36:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

If the goal is to expose the actual host to administrators than it should be done via an extension that is only visible to an admin. For example, see:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/extended_server_attributes.py'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-10-29 20:14:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

commit_message:
bug/1035350 Add 'host' field to Cinder API

An administrator user in Horizon wants to be able to see the "Host"
field of a volume.  In order to support this feature in Horizon the
Cinder API must expose the value from the database.

This change simply adds the "host" field in the appropriate Cinder API
responses.

Fixes: bug #1035350
Change-Id: I0edf56c0239bbafdb390f6937a352ffa75452697

Fixes bug 1064070

The patch adds a log entry indication that the service has started. In
addition to this if there is an "exit" statement in the code, then the
log message will indicate that the service has been terminated.

Change-Id: Idb6cff4b85d26331df2c6e14aa0680e82b4e2cd7
'}]
commit_message:
Logging indicates when service starts and terminates

Fixes bug 1064070

The patch adds a log entry indication that the service has started. In
addition to this if there is an "exit" statement in the code, then the
log message will indicate that the service has been terminated.

Change-Id: Idb6cff4b85d26331df2c6e14aa0680e82b4e2cd7

commit_message:
Ensure that the SqlSoup import is still supported.

The sqlalchemy package 0.8.0b1 released on October 30, 2012
removed SQLSoup (http://docs.sqlalchemy.org/en/latest/changelog/migration_08.html#sqlsoup)

A number of quantum agents make use of this code to access the
database.

Change-Id: I6ed6424277d60598d9b2b66eb0b206f1a634991e

commit_message:
Avoid RPC calls while holding iptables lock.

This exhibitied itself as very slow instance starts on a Canonical
test cluster. This was because do_referesh_security_group_rules()
was making rpc calls while holding the iptables lock. This refactor
avoids that while making no functional changes (I hope).

Fixes bug: 1062314
Change-Id: I36f805bd72f7bd06082cfe96c58d637203bcffb7
Cherry-picked: ba585524e32965697c1a44c8fd743dea060bb1af
Conflicts:
	nova/virt/firewall.py

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-10-23 08:58:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-10-23 16:55:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

If the tests fail if http proxy is set - how about unsetting it in the test setup or similar place? Unsetting it in the tox config I think is going to mess up people who are doing pip-based things - and putting that in tox.ini and run_tests.sh  also breaks our current assertion that one _should_ be able to run nosetests with no additional hacking around and have the tests run."}, {'account_id': 1528, 'date': '2012-10-23 17:00:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

As I mentioned - no experience with tox, so if it doesn't map exactly to the change in run_tests, I can remove it.

I'd like to keep the change in run_tests though. Changing environmental variables in the test itself seems to be risky and depending on the library implementation. Ie. depending on whether the variable is reread after initialisation or not. Since environmental variables are usually set before the process starts, I wanted to keep it outside... in the environment.

run_tests change will not impact pip installation since the option is added only to the unit testing stage.

Anyway - this is my rationale. Would you accept the change if I dropped the tox change, or do you prefer unsetting it in the code?"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-31 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-31 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Make sure proxies are not used in testing

Some tests require creating connection (like S3APITestCase). These
tests may fail if http_proxy is set, so unset it when calling
nosetests. Ensure it doesn't affect virtual environment installation.

Change-Id: If522328c2c07f252bb9befaa4833ec79f31ad1ce

Looks like a nice start at getting something going.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-10-23 06:22:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

What would u think of a new logging level? LOG.metric? Or something that hides the fact a logger is being used. 

Something like a 'MetricWriterFactory' (for example) that could return a LOG backed metric 'storage', or a 'syslog' backed one, or a ..."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-10-23 17:31:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm wondering if going "home brew" with metrics is the right thing for Nova?

That said, I've certainly done similar things with my own apps before but on a more well beaten path like Nova this feels a bit dirty.

Would time be better spent creating a more generic Python metrics framework that follows some of patterns outlined in more mature frameworks like:

 https://github.com/codahale/metrics

Ruby seems to have a good start on it as well:

 https://github.com/johnewart/ruby-metrics

Most importantly I'd like to see the infrastructure for something like this a lot more pluggable.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2012-10-23 17:49:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

@ Dan Prince. This is the final goal and one that I hope to get going on. I think this review though is just to test the waters a little :-)'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-31 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

commit_message:
Implement simple metrics collection.

I was intending to do something a little different than this just
for log metrics, but then the metrics collection session at the
summit convinced me that a more generic approach was required.

The only metric currently collected is how long run_instance takes.

This change implements blueprint nova-instrumentation-v1.

Change-Id: Idfafe1dd76f53bb0b9213c79bffd4b1bab5ef957

Remove lxc attach support

Remove lxc attaching/detaching of LXC volumes. This
functionality should be moved into the proper libvirt driver

Change-Id: I14c202e59ff6b7a8b5b19180235d346b1bd4ee09
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Use queue_arguments for fanout consumers too.

Fixes bug 1071528

queue_arguments (currently only x-ha-policy for now) were only
set for topic consumers, this adds support for rabbit HA for
fanout consumers too.

commit_message:
Add setup.py for registering namespace package

Create a dummy package and setup.py file solely to be used
to register the name "oslo" on PyPI.

Change-Id: Ica9dd1cf05fda36c317223ead22a94f337f3ae21
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-30 21:38:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a logic error in stable version calculation.

Milestone information in blank for stable branches, so there is no milestone
prefix. However, we were blindly concatenating the milestone version
prefix onto the datestamp.

Fixes bug 1059634.

Change-Id: I6cff4ee7f6c1dc970397b66fd2d15fa22b0a63a3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a logic error in stable version calculation.

Milestone information in blank for stable branches, so there is no milestone
prefix. However, we were blindly concatenating the milestone version
prefix onto the datestamp.

Fixes bug 1059634.

Change-Id: I6cff4ee7f6c1dc970397b66fd2d15fa22b0a63a3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-30 21:33:55.000000000', 'message': 'cfg: fix required if option has a dash

If an option has a dash in it and is required, the check fails because it
tries to self._get() on the name (with dash) rather than the dest (with
underscore).

Change-Id: I6448019f70f98bc2e58a325d0cf9ce88b8bb085b
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>
'}]
commit_message:
cfg: fix required if option has a dash

If an option has a dash in it and is required, the check fails because it
tries to self._get() on the name (with dash) rather than the dest (with
underscore).

Change-Id: I6448019f70f98bc2e58a325d0cf9ce88b8bb085b
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Remove database usage from libvirt check_can_live_migrate_destination

While libvirt is the only one that actually uses the compute host info
during this check, I think that it's an entirely reasonable thing to
pass to each hypervisor when doing the "can I migrate to this host"
check. Thus, I've added it excplicitly, without a gating check of
the capabilities.

Related to bp:no-db-compute

Change-Id: I7049879fcec3894165f1bece9beeb045ed78c94b

commit_message:
Return HTTP 404 for deleted images in v2

For admin contexts, the db api will return deleted images. This patch
manually checks for deleted images in the v2 controller code to treat
these cases as if the images didn't exist.

Fixes bug 1071446

Change-Id: I33075f94e9d560a279085e2afd18c8052f57d60b

commit_message:
Split out drivers in san.py

The SolarisISCSIDriver and HpSanISCSIDriver have been removed from
san.py and placed in their own files. The default SanISCSIDriver
implementing some common methods still resides in san.py. These
san drivers have now been grouped in the san module.

Implements bp driver-cleanup

Change-Id: I68802f01a4a8c7e93e097777d305fbee0d15128a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-30 15:49:30.000000000', 'message': "Fixed bugs re: make_pre_authed* and SCRIPT_NAME

There were bugs with SCRIPT_NAME and
swift.common.wsgi.make_pre_authed* functions.

1) SCRIPT_NAME wasn't copied with PATH_INFO, which it should've been.
2) When a new path was given, SCRIPT_NAME wasn't set to an empty
   string but just omitted, which is allowed by spec, but really
   should be set.

For completeness, if SCRIPT_NAME doesn't exist in the source env, it
will be created in the new env, but as an empty string.

Change-Id: Ifbc27ed8ff357038c54df4d37de46cfd5e31372e
"}, {'created': '2012-10-30 15:54:12.000000000', 'message': "Fixed bugs re: make_pre_authed* and SCRIPT_NAME

There were bugs with SCRIPT_NAME and
swift.common.wsgi.make_pre_authed* functions.

1) SCRIPT_NAME wasn't copied with PATH_INFO, which it should've been.
2) When a new path was given, SCRIPT_NAME wasn't set to an empty
   string but just omitted, which is allowed by spec, but really
   should be set.

For completeness, if SCRIPT_NAME doesn't exist in the source env, it
will be created in the new env, but as an empty string.

Change-Id: Ifbc27ed8ff357038c54df4d37de46cfd5e31372e
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed bugs re: make_pre_authed* and SCRIPT_NAME

There were bugs with SCRIPT_NAME and
swift.common.wsgi.make_pre_authed* functions.

1) SCRIPT_NAME wasn't copied with PATH_INFO, which it should've been.
2) When a new path was given, SCRIPT_NAME wasn't set to an empty
   string but just omitted, which is allowed by spec, but really
   should be set.

For completeness, if SCRIPT_NAME doesn't exist in the source env, it
will be created in the new env, but as an empty string.

Change-Id: Ifbc27ed8ff357038c54df4d37de46cfd5e31372e

compute/manager.py to the global flags.py

Fixes deletion of invalid image member

This fixes the 500 error on deleting an invalid/non-member tenant of an image.

Fixes LP: #1060868

Change-Id: I5a2dc56690d7525127be1a8843004d075a3fe5bb

commit_message:
improve sessions around compute_node_*

Removed 'session' parameter from public method compute_node_get,
and replaced private calls with new method _compute_node_get.
Removed unused session paramter from other compute_node_* methods.

Change-Id: I943306be014b61d8818fdbe7891f6ad5ef934751

[{'created': '2012-09-13 12:52:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed httplib2 mocking (bug 1050091, bug 1050097)

- 204 No Content should be mocked with empty response bodies
- Content-Type headers should not be mocked with empty response bodies
- httplib2 would never return None as a response body
- The Identity API never expects a req/resp body with a string value of "null"

Change-Id: Ie22e8e5288573268165ed06049978195955f8ca6
'}, {'created': '2012-09-13 12:52:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed httplib2 mocking (bug 1050091, bug 1050097)

- Content-Type headers should not be mocked with empty response bodies

- The Identity API never expects a req/resp body with a string value of "null"

Change-Id: Ie22e8e5288573268165ed06049978195955f8ca6
'}, {'created': '2012-09-13 12:52:11.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed httplib2 mocking (bug 1050091, bug 1050097)

- 204 No Content should be mocked with empty response bodies
- Content-Type headers should not be mocked with empty response bodies
- httplib2 would never return None as a response body
- The Identity API never expects a req/resp body with a string value of "null"

Change-Id: Ie22e8e5288573268165ed06049978195955f8ca6
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed httplib2 mocking (bug 1050091, bug 1050097)

- 204 No Content should be mocked with empty response bodies
- Content-Type headers should not be mocked with empty response bodies
- httplib2 would never return None as a response body
- The Identity API never expects a req/resp body with a string value of "null"

Change-Id: Ie22e8e5288573268165ed06049978195955f8ca6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-23 19:50:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix support for Unicode volume names

It is possible to create a Unicode volume from the command line,
but it cannot be manipulated by name for operations such as delete.
This is because the find_resource function tries to match the
Unicode string to a regular byte string, and a UnicodeWarning is
issued, failing the match.  Fix by decoding the Unicode name when
trying to match.

Fixes bug 1065275.

Change-Id: I8e19a78bbc1ccb503ccd39dc3b904fc4f6f77858
'}]
commit_message:
Fix support for Unicode volume names

It is possible to create a Unicode volume from the command line,
but it cannot be manipulated by name for operations such as delete.
This is because the find_resource function tries to match the
Unicode string to a regular byte string, and a UnicodeWarning is
issued, failing the match.  Fix by decoding the Unicode name when
trying to match.

Fixes bug 1065275.

Change-Id: I8e19a78bbc1ccb503ccd39dc3b904fc4f6f77858

commit_message:
Set default for --os-cacert to None

The default option for --os-cacert was an empty string. This causes
httplib2 to fail, since it expects the ca_cert parameter to be None in
order to use the default ca_cert file.

Fixes bug #1073193

Change-Id: Ie8eb196e2c623d9b2a8a8f9cb21d68f15390a820

Implements one workitem of blueprint Move all functionality out

It will only return the hosts that availability_zone=xxx.

commit_message:
Support for nova client list hosts with specific zone

Implements one workitem of blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

This add an optional QUEY_STRING(zone=xxx) in /v1.1/{tenant_id}/os-hosts.
So we can also send /v1.1/{tenant_id}/os-hosts?zone=xxx now.
It will only return the hosts that availability_zone=xxx.

Change-Id: I89f2c0bf50f8ea1ef9f06da664f5c4b24098e5df

Other than the TABs, lgtm...'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-10-30 15:49:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Work In Progress

Let's make sure every one agrees with this."}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2012-10-30 15:49:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

A few things:

1) On master, there is only one test run currently, and that includes cinder (n-vol is not tested in master any longer).  Both tests will run only for the stable/folsom branch.  Is it worth optimizing that case, considering that we're moving on from there?  Those jenkins jobs run in parallel anyway, so there won't be any time savings.

2) Separately, are we sure it isn't worth running the other tests?  In an integration test suite, wouldn't it be nice to catch bugs related to different components interacting with each other?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-30 15:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/15025/2/check/gate-devstack-gate-merge/301 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/15025/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/16050 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-10-30 15:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

++'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-10-30 15:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-10-30 15:49:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but whitespace content has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-10-30 15:49:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Abandoned

I didn't know about this recent change to master. With regard to your second question, n-vol and cinder are kind of like plugins. I don't think we can test the cross product of all pluggable configurations."}]

commit_message:
Run only volume tests if configured for nova-volumes.

It is not necessary to run gating tests twice that have nothing to do with volumes with/without cinder.

Change-Id: I20730eb126dcee22bc0957dbcbddabc87f6058a0

It's possible that requested_networks will be empty but not None.
Especially since novaclient defaults to an empty list.  This avoids
attempting an unnecessary validation.

Change-Id: I131dbb3f6cc6167e150d4a46386e6b0b51035579
"}]
commit_message:
More robust checking for empty requested_networks

It's possible that requested_networks will be empty but not None.
Especially since novaclient defaults to an empty list.  This avoids
attempting an unnecessary validation.

Change-Id: I131dbb3f6cc6167e150d4a46386e6b0b51035579

[{'created': '2012-10-26 17:07:29.000000000', 'message': 'xenapi: refactor: Agent class

Related to blueprint xenapi-config-drive

As config drive and agent are doing similar operations, part of the
config drive introduction, we would like to make the agent optional.
This refactor is introducing an agent class holding together the agent
operations, as a first step.

The steps were:
Introduce XenAPIBasedAgent
Added constructor parameters to XenAPIBasedAgent
get rid of parameters on get_agent_version
get rid of parameters on agent_update
get rid of parameters on set_admin_password
get rid of parameters on inject_file
get rid of parameters on resetnetwork
Correct newlines
add factory method for getting an agent instance

For the small changes, see:
https://github.com/citrix-openstack/nova/commits/agent2class

Change-Id: I3928c0776ff98c830c19487eb8ff7820e41ca025
'}]
commit_message:
xenapi: refactor: Agent class

Related to blueprint xenapi-config-drive

As config drive and agent are doing similar operations, part of the
config drive introduction, we would like to make the agent optional.
This refactor is introducing an agent class holding together the agent
operations, as a first step.

The steps were:
Introduce XenAPIBasedAgent
Added constructor parameters to XenAPIBasedAgent
get rid of parameters on get_agent_version
get rid of parameters on agent_update
get rid of parameters on set_admin_password
get rid of parameters on inject_file
get rid of parameters on resetnetwork
Correct newlines
add factory method for getting an agent instance

For the small changes, see:
https://github.com/citrix-openstack/nova/commits/agent2class

Change-Id: I3928c0776ff98c830c19487eb8ff7820e41ca025

commit_message:
Fix sqlalchemy performance problem

Fixes bug #1070074 too much lazy loading on the
default model.  Removed those and only added lazy
loading to queries that specifically need eager
loading

Change-Id: Ifa7446bddef855ae8e8b76040ba3336a53606215

commit_message:
timestamp columns in sqlalchemy not timezone aware

Fixes bug # 1066148.  Sqlalchemy schema timezone
fields are not timezone aware therefore the
timestamps need to be adjusted as such

Change-Id: I0979fe3b9487257f988790ddb23a317a3df7a19d

commit_message:
Add call to trigger_instance[add/remove]_security_group_refresh quantum

The calls to trigger_instance[add/remove]_security_group_refresh were
not being called in quantumv2/api. This patch adds those calls and also
removes the code previously required to handle the circular dependency which
is no longer there.  Fixes bug 1057069

Change-Id: Ia76d37ebf2546a26f893dcbc8d5a05f02324ad6b

"}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-10-30 08:42:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

These changes allow one to create a port and plug it into the wrong bridge very easily.  Consider requiring that a user pass the l3_agent config .  The config should have the correct bridges specified for the deployment.  The debug agent can determine via code whether a network is a internal or external and choose the correct bridge from the config.

This bug fix needs unit test too.'}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-10-30 08:42:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

This only works when you quantum-debug is invoked as the admin user.  Regular users cannot create probes because the debug fails to find the subnet attached to the external network.  

I also found another bug related to rootwrap that causes the quantum-debug to fail in most cases. (I've created a new bug for that issue because I think it needs a bit of discussion)."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-10-30 08:42:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

I understand that tempest gating uses the admin user, but this limitation should be documented.  If not, the knowledge of the problem is only limited to those folks who've read this review or take the time to troubleshoot the issue when it arises."}, {'account_id': 2592, 'date': '2012-10-30 08:42:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 693, 'date': '2012-10-22 17:50:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

The only place those functions should be called from is the inject_data function which creates a temporary mount_dir for the fs in _DiskImage().mount(). If that's None, the fix should go into _DiskImage. 

If a fix cannot be applied there and the _inject_*_ functions are being called from anywhere else, then the best place to add the fs check is in _inject_file_into_fs() since it's called by all of the _inject_*_ functions."}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-10-22 18:58:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Would love to see a small unit-test here, documenting that fs can be None, and hopefully preventing future regressions from someone not realizing that.

++ on Chris' suggestion for where the fix should go as well."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-30 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-30 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]

commit_message:
Check for filesystem before injecting.

_inject_key_into_fs and _inject_metadata_into_fs
should check fs is None or not

LP: #886260

Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
2

Change-Id: Ia27737a53b2f3ecebd159bf3e8bb69b8ce64d7ad

commit_message:
Get subnets of router interfaces with an elevated context.

Fixes bug 1057558

A router may have interfaces owned by other tenants (by admin operations).
An elevated context is required to get subnet information for such interfaces.

Change-Id: Iaf24c842c2c1e3c52573e7f9831d5f6d8fc01885

commit_message:
swiftclient Connection : default optional arguments to None

Default the authurl/user/key constructor arguments for the
Connection class to None, as these are not required in the
preauthurl/preauthtoken case

Change-Id: I445a5d365212c365ecc691c0a670a226e2b7954a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-23 08:11:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fix non standard 100-continue behaviour

Swift proxy server, when communicating with the back-end servers ALWAYS sends 100-continue. Even if the length headers indicate that there is no body (content-length: 0). This behavior is not inline with the standard.
As a minimum, swift must avoid sending 100-continue for PUT requests without a body (content-length is zero).
It is highly desired that the swift would also avoid sending 100-continue for any objects below some threshold (e.g. 64K)
Alternatively, this threshold may be configurable.

On branch bp/wsgi-application-interface-5
   modified:   swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py

Fixes: Bug #1070025
Implements Blueprint:  	wsgi-application-interface

Change-Id: Ia4eb8b886a74968cca4e8bde208641b37f2c104c
'}, {'created': '2012-10-23 17:50:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix non standard 100-continue behaviour

Swift proxy server, when communicating with the back-end servers ALWAYS sends 100-continue. Even if the length headers indicate that there is no body (content-length: 0). This behavior is not inline with the standard.
RFC2616:8.2.3 disallows 100-continue for req.content_length==0

As a minimum, swift must avoid sending 100-continue for PUT requests without a body (content-length is zero).
The use of 100-continue adds a round trip delay and somewhat adds to cpu and network load of small objects.
At the same time, it is 100-continue is useful only when objects are large
For efficiency reasons, it is desired to it is desired to avoid sending 100-continue for objects below some threshold (e.g. 64K)
Alternatively, this threshold may be configurable.

commit_message:
Fix non standard 100-continue behaviour

Swift proxy server, when communicating with
the back-end servers ALWAYS sends 100-continue.
Even if the length headers indicate that there
is no body (content-length: 0).
This behavior is not inline with the standard.
RFC2616:8.2.3 disallows 100-continue
        for req.content_length==0

This fix removes 100-continue during PUT requests
without a body while maintining the ability for
handoff in case of faliure.

On branch bp/wsgi-application-interface-5
   modified:   swift/proxy/controllers/obj.py

Fixes: Bug #1070025
Implements Blueprint:  	wsgi-application-interface

Change-Id: Ia4eb8b886a74968cca4e8bde208641b37f2c104c

commit_message:
Fixes bug/1035734

adds a chapter on instance management to Compute Admin guide

refactors nova-cli guide for easier reuse of elements
inserts new sections on ssh keys, userdata injection
and file injection to Nova CLI Gude instance creation section

Removes the blank sections about "boot from ISO" and "boot from
config drive" because at least the config drive is now covered.

Change-Id: Id882d54d537ac6e0b22203763481a4afb88859d8

[{'created': '2012-10-29 21:00:30.000000000', 'message': 'Auto-Assign Flavor ID

This patch gives the user the option to auto-assign a flavor ID.
The ID chosen is the smallest positive integer available. Users
can still specify an ID if they desire. Any invalid inputs for
flavor ID triggers the auto-assign feature.

Change-Id: Ibd757bf2ac1c900112198898e9365e6fce9b43b5
'}]
commit_message:
Auto-Assign Flavor ID

This patch gives the user the option to auto-assign a flavor ID.
The ID chosen is the smallest positive integer available. Users
can still specify an ID if they desire. Any invalid inputs for
flavor ID triggers the auto-assign feature.

Change-Id: Ibd757bf2ac1c900112198898e9365e6fce9b43b5

commit_message:
Add VolumeHostAttribute API extension

Expose the host on which a volume resides through a new API
extension. This is only presented to Admins by default. This
can be controlled with the 'volume_host_attribute' policy
rule.

Fixes bug 1035350.

Change-Id: I0a74a0dfbd78e853219150fbe0d3fba77c6f9bb6

'}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-10-29 13:39:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm fine with the change, but I would like Dan Prince to confirm that he has not started working on squashing the migrations.  This patch isn't worth causing conflicts to that if he has already started.  Otherwise, fine by me to go in."}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2012-10-29 18:15:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Fine by me although these migrations will go away soon enough (once I wrap up the compacted version for Folsom).

Doesn't really make much difference either way."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-10-29 18:32:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

As these migrations are going away soon, I don't see much value in fixing import order now. 

Additionally, we do not run all hacking.py tests on the migrations right now.  If we were to fix import order we might as well fix one import per line and enable hacking.py for all migrations."}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-10-29 20:44:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Validates Timestamp or Expiry time in EC2 requests

Validating the format of Timestamp/Expires in the EC2 requests
and checking for the expiry of the request. 'ec2_timestamp_expiry'
flag is the time in seconds before ec2 timestamp expires.

Fixes bug 1036343

Change-Id: I2b63d85dc1d658a58ceda67c0dfd0a8eac807577

subject: Ensures compute_driver flag can be used by api and volume
messages:
[{'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-10-08 15:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Don't like doing this, but it seems to "fix" the bug. Checking the compute flag in the volume and api code seems very wrong, but not sure about any alternatives right now.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-10-08 16:47:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

There is a comment right above this section with the XenAPI work around that this is just because xenapi doesn't set root device. Can this be fixed in the right way instead of another work around?"}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-10-08 17:34:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Agreed, I was looking for a quick fix to get things working while we come up with a more graceful fix.

However, there are other bits of code failing too like this one:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/commit/625996722f08b57b2926cf4d6aff5fe03abc196c#L11R101
Although you could argue that the above would really just be a misconfiguration, so the check is perhaps overkill.

Not sure if there are others right now.

End of the day for me now, so it will be tomorrow before I can take a look I am afraid.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-10 20:59:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

lets just use flags.DECLARE() to explicitly declare where the flag is defined when we need to use it. Then we can just remove the declare along with the use of the flag when the code is fixed."}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-10-11 16:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-10-11 16:41:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 782, 'date': '2012-10-11 16:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I just tried using flags.DECLARE, but that seems to cause circular imports :('}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-11 17:07:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- http://logs.openstack.org/14170/2/check/gate-nova-merge/9942 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/14170/2/check/gate-nova-docs/5697 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/14170/2/check/gate-nova-pep8/11007 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/14170/2/check/gate-nova-python27/7217 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/14170/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/14292 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/14170/2/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm-cinder/4271 : FAILURE
- http://logs.openstack.org/14170/2/check/gate-nova-pylint/1562 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-11 17:58:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

god i'm tired of that code:

/opt/stack/nova/nova/compute/__init__.py", line 25'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-11 18:00:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

This patch fixes that particular import:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12311/

It also adds some unneccessary stuff, maybe I will clean it up and repropose.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-11 19:36:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

this patchset should fix the circular imports:
https://review.openstack.org/14353
Unfortunately it is too big to backport, so I guess go back to the other method of moving the flag declaration.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-10-12 11:51:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I still think this is the wrong approach. The issue is that the xen driver isn't exposing disk defaults (like the libvirt driver does), so now we're sticking a default catch for the virt driver up in the generic block layer.

The right fix is to fix the xen driver."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-12 17:57:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Sean: the correct fix is to clean up the block device code:

https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/improve-block-device-handling

unfortunately, the right fix requires db migrations which we shouldn't backport, so we need something like this for backporting to folsom."}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-10-12 18:12:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

fair, but this isn't a folsom issue. It's a grizzly issue."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-12 18:34:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sean: actually, I think the wrong source commit was referenced in the bug. I believe the bad commit was actually: 

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14068/

Which is on the list to be backported to folsom.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-10-12 19:01:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

ah ok.

I guess the question here is why not just for the work around have xen driver provide a default on guest creation. It seems really weird to put that default way up in the stack.

Is there something else that would break if xen filled out root_device to a guest when it was created? (https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14404/ wip idea)'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-12 19:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sean: sure, although it would probably make sense to change the existing variable:

https://github.com/vishvananda/nova/blob/master/nova/virt/xenapi/vmops.py#L161

The issue is that there needs to be a db migration for pre-existing instances, so if we are going to go that far, (and since we need something we can backport), it might make more sense to just leave the workaround in place until we implement the blueprint i linked above.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-10-12 20:07:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Sure, guess I missed that var the first time around. :)

Are the instances long lived enough that we think a migration is in order? or will a code fix just be able to handle it by filling out that field by default.'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-12 20:15:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

a code fix might work, but I think the block_device_mapping table may need to be fixed and/or filled out as well, so I db migration might be preferrable.'}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-10-12 20:31:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

good point. Ok, I'll try to get a passing patch on the default value of instance, then block_device_mapping can be handled after."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-10-20 06:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-10-29 19:59:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

resurrected the first version here: https://review.openstack.org/14991'}]

commit_message:
Ensures compute_driver flag can be used by api and volume

Fixes bug 1063851 by moving compute_driver flag from
compute/manager.py to the global flags.py

Change-Id: I850b0d49be7f90a9faad53d23cfc39aa4717ea8b

Make nova-rootwrap optional

Make the use of nova-rootwrap optional if the current process's
effective user id is already root.

commit_message:
Addtional 2 packages for dev environment on ubuntu

In file doc/source/devref/development.environment.rst added packages
build-dep and python-mysqldb which I have had to add on ubuntu 12.04
to enable the dev environment to be setup. Without these run_tests.sh
fails with error 'mysql_config not found' when setting up the virtual env.

Change-Id: I4af775386469deecf122a9e165457f241339b20b

I'd rather fix the old style calls, no? Where are they?"}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-10-29 16:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Actually the debate is "closed" about what source should be, and the fact that my previous change broke something tells me we miss some unit tests to catch them! The source not being set to cfg.CONF.counter_source is a bug.

So I'd prefer a patch adding unit test and fixing calls to publish_counter(), really :)'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-10-29 16:53:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-10-29 16:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@jd_

Sure, the proper long-term fix is to address the incomplete publish_counter() calls.

As I wrote in the commit message, this is just intended as temporary measure, in the spirit of trunk never being broken.

Especially if the debate is still on-going as to the form of source to use (correct if that was concluded).

The breakage I tripped over is in ceilometer/compute/manager.py. Also in ceilometer/central/manager.py by the looks of it.'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-10-29 16:53:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Abandoning in favor of a direct fix.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-29 16:53:08.000000000', 'message': "Avoid TypeError in old-style publish_counter calls.

We still have calls to publish_counter() that don't specify the
source explicitly, causing the following error since the function
signature has changed:

  TypeError: publish_counter() takes exactly 5 arguments (4 given)

Restore the old default placeholder source value ('?') as a temporary
measure until a meaningful source is used in all cases.

Change-Id: I26bbc0ab5e4676ce7278b7a25715f3d747baf19d
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid TypeError in old-style publish_counter calls.

We still have calls to publish_counter() that don't specify the
source explicitly, causing the following error since the function
signature has changed:

  TypeError: publish_counter() takes exactly 5 arguments (4 given)

Restore the old default placeholder source value ('?') as a temporary
measure until a meaningful source is used in all cases.

Change-Id: I26bbc0ab5e4676ce7278b7a25715f3d747baf19d

commit_message:
Add dependencies on clients used by pollsters

Move the test requirement for glanceclient to an installation
requirement, since the central pollster uses it.

Add an installation requirement for cinderclient, since there
is also a central pollster that needs it.

Change-Id: I01fcc7c1d69a02b6ebf62b2c851e0e862f3439d9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
If heat is enabled, replace nova flavors.

All heat users will need to run heat/tools/nova_create_flavors.sh as an admin
user. This change runs nova_create_flavors.sh if heat is enabled.

This saves the hassle of switching to an admin user and running this every time
devstack is started.

Flavors are changed in heat_init, so heat_init is deferred until after nova
is running.

Change-Id: I4576c83f5ef55809567e40e56c25eb0e1bbe6d45

commit_message:
Add a variable to control keystone token format

This change lets the developer running devstack
control the token format used by keystone through
setting KEYSTONE_TOKEN_FORMAT in their localrc
file.

Change-Id: Ic1265fcb10b8de112891f61d5e07312322148ec2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
clear screen rc file every time you run stack.sh

fixes bug 1032022.

Devstack will not update service's start up command if the command already
exists in screen rc files due to previous deployment. There is no way to
clear a service's start up command so this would be a problem if the service's
start up command changes between different deployment. Clear the content of
screen rc file every time you run stack.sh to deploy openstack can solve
this problem.

Change-Id: I18d0700bb2169bdb0dadfa7982168aef2eff8b22

commit_message:
Delete VMs in the error state immediately.

If a VM is in an error state do not wait 24 hours to delete it. Perform
the deletion immediately.

Change-Id: I07dea7971c3cd95215204759779ce650675f244f
